results.text: The root words of God sending a Savior to His people goes back into Genesis, Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers, and Deuteronomy.
Those who treasure God's Word will find God's Word will keep them IN righteousness and OUT OF sin.
Christ-followers are to highly treasure their fear of (awe, trust, reverence) God - letting such impact their day to day life.
People put their treasure or valuables into what or Who they worship.
A spiritually healthy attitude toward God's Word is to treasure it more than food for the stomach.
Heaven's great gifts cannot be purchased with earth's vast treasures.
Those who are rich toward God have built up treasures in heaven though those who are NOT rich toward God may have built up treasures on earth - to be left behind one day.
Believing God's Word can bring a person to take actions which reflect one finds greater value in following Christ than in vast earthly treasures.
A spiritual leader would do well to flee from the pursuit of material things and pursue instead the great spiritual treasures of righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patience, and gentleness.

Spiritual leaders are greatly concerned for those they minister to that (1) their hearts be encouraged due to being knit together in love and (2) attaining all the riches that come from the full assurance of understanding, (3) having the knowledge of the mystery of God, and (4) all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge that are in the LORD.
Those who seek (like treasure hunting) God and His wisdom will come to respect God more and find the awesome knowledge of God.
Those who are irresponsible with material things will not likely be trusted with spiritual treasures.

Spiritual leaders and disciple makers have a great burden for those they lead: (1) to see them have real 'heart' courage, (2) to be knit together in love, and (3) to experience all the riches of understanding and knowledge of their relationship to God and to Christ - in whom are found all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.
Disciples of Jesus need not get caught up in 'fattening' their material life with earthly treasures.
Building up treasures on earth keeps one's heart focused on earthly matters.
One's heart will be focused on where his or her treasure resides.
The greatest mystery is known in the fact that God in His fullness is revealed in Jesus Christ - as well as the treasures of wisdom and knowledge are in Christ Jesus.
God's people are God's treasured possession.
The knowledge of the glory of Christ Jesus is a treasure each Christ-follower possesses.
Christ-followers do not have ability or power to contribute to this treasure - found in Christ.
Those Christ-followers who share this world's treasures with others will be laying up treasures in the world to come - eternal.
Christ-followers are to invest their lives in treasures of heavenly or spiritual nature because where one's treasure is there will their heart be also.
To know and walk with Christ are of greater value than any earthly treasure.
One's heart will be in alignment with where their treasurer is invested.
Treasure stored in heaven have a sure reward and cannot be stolen or destroyed by rust.
There are differing levels of responsibilities connected to various stewardships - some being very high and related to handling money, gold, and earthly treasures.

One's stewardship in coming to Christ in salvation or walking intimately with the LORD does not always mean giving away to the poor all his possessions or wealth, but it does mean shifting the full ownership of their earthly treasures to God - willingly becoming the steward, not owner.
Those who shift ownership of their earthly treasures to God gain heavenly treasures to be experienced in the future.
This is a test treasure, delete after testing
While the Hebrew people are a special treasure to God, those IN CHRIST are His adopted children by faith.
The root words of God sending a Savior to His people goes back into Genesis, Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers, and Deuteronomy.
What boldness (how assuring) one can have recognizing (by God's grace) your assigned 'life message' aligns rightly with the Scriptures - Law, Prophets, Psalms.
Jesus not only gives credence to the Psalms as Scripture, but points out the Psalmists were at times writing about Him.
The Book of Psalms has prophetic value and accuracy.
Resurrection beyond the grave was taught in the Psalms through David.
A proper view of the LORD (fear, awesome respect - like Isaiah expresses in 6:1-8) will bring one to depart from evil ways.
John the baptist is identified as the 'messenger' prophesied by Isaiah.
Jeremiah testifies God is Creator of earth and man.
Daniel, recognizes Jeremiah as a prophet of God and his writings as prophecies.
The root words of God sending a Savior to His people goes back into Genesis, Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers, and Deuteronomy.
The depth of the riches of God's wisdom and knowledge are beyond a full search or knowing fully by man.
God may choose a young, humble servant to grant through the Spirit His favor by giving him wisdom for carrying out God's will.
Wisdom to make peace is better than war.
Those who follow Christ should seek of the LORD wisdom and understanding - discernment to know and do what is right in His eyes.
The manifest wisdom of God (through His servant) stirs fear and respect toward God.
God can increase a man's capacity for wisdom and understanding as well as his heart for grasping truth and knowledge.
Those in Christ who reach out for, receive, apply, seek, and search for God's wisdom will know it.
Those who attain great wealth, wisdom, and recognition would do well to recognize God as the Source.
Always seek knowledge, wisdom, and understanding from the LORD.
The value of 'wisdom from God' is beyond comparison.
Those who diligently seek wisdom from God will find it.
Wisdom, knowledge, and understanding are found IN THE LORD and in knowing the LORD.
Gaining God's wisdom and understanding are more valuable than gold or silver.
As sure as eating a honeycomb is sweet on the tongue, so is the knowledge of God's wisdom by a Christ-follower to his soul - along with a real, meaningful future.
Blessed are a people whose leadership operates in God's righteousness and God's wisdom.
Those who, in Christ, desire wisdom should ask of God - for His great wisdom (James 1:5).
God's wisdom is characterized as (1) pure / clean / modest, (2) peaceable, (3) gentle, (4) willing to yield, (5) full of mercy, (6) produces 'good,' void of partiality and void of hypocrisy.
Man can dig, find, and produce wealth from the earth, but does not find true wisdom and understanding which are held and revealed in portions by God.
Longevity of life does not equate to gaining God's wisdom and understanding.
The larger one's wisdom grows the larger that one's responsibility will grow.
Man's days on earth are so brief - one should seek to live according to God's grace and wisdom.
God created Lucifer (Satan) with beauty and wisdom, pride and sin entered because of the beauty and wisdom, and God judged Satan because of sin.
God gives some of His faithful ones superior wisdom, humble spirit, and Spirit-led boldness along with favor by national leaders.

In a day of general rebellion from God and ignorance of God, the spiritual leaders who should be serving with wisdom, direction, and righteousness are instead operating in foolishness, confusion, and corruption.
When a Christ-follower sees clearly the knowledge revealed through the wisdom God has granted, the prospects of obtaining what he or she hopes for - from the Lord's revelation - come into view.
God grants more of Himself and His 'heavenly gifts' - light, wisdom, grace, productivity, Word - to those who receive and implement what He gave them already.
God is the source of all wisdom and understanding - dispensing it as He pleases to whomever He chooses.
Christ-followers should avoid being deceived by worldly or natural wisdom while realizing the wisdom of God is theirs, they are Christ's, and Christ is God's.
Proclaimers of God's Gospel need to allow their messages to demonstrate God's Spirit and God's power rather than man's wisdom, man's confidence, or man's strength.
Those in Christ can and should glory in Christ who is our wisdom, righteousness, sanctification, and redemption.
The message of the Gospel is clearly focused on proclaiming Christ crucified - to some foolishness, to some a stumbling block, but to those called by God IT IS THE POWER OF GOD AND THE WISDOM OF GOD.
God is not discovered or known through human wisdom or intellect.
Proclaiming God's gospel is not about 'wisdom of words' used or cleverness of the presentation, but clearly and only to be on the subject of the Gospel which is Jesus Christ.
Older in age does not guarantee one has gained wisdom along the way.
The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom and to depart from evil is understanding.
God is the source of wisdom and understanding and He grants these to His faith-children.
Many may be astonished when one of their own - a local, ordinary man - returns home full of God's Spirit, power, and wisdom.
Those in Christ are given knowledge to the mysteries, the Word, and the wisdom of God.
How did Jesus 'perceive' these thoughts of these men but by the spiritual gift (Spirit's manifestation) of discernment, knowledge, or wisdom working in the Spirit-filled Christ.
Being aged does not guarantee having wisdom and understanding.
The spiritual qualifications for service in the body of Christ - service of food distribution - might be (1) good reputation, (2) full of the Holy Spirit, and (3) full of wisdom.
The LORD wants His disciples to know Him intimately, in power, in wisdom, and in His presence - so He will go to extreme measures to reveal Himself.
The ungodly will try all kinds of schemes to distract, dissuade, and discourage the faithful obedience of God's people.  Thus, the godly must continue to lean upon God for wisdom and guidance.
God's truth and wisdom can put to shame and quiet those who try to expose God's truth as erroneous.
Jesus, the man (here the young man) increased in wisdom and stature - He was maturing in mind, soul, and body.
Even a young man (pre-teen) like Jesus can learn of the LORD and interact with others with God's wisdom, truth, and favor.
The wisdom of the LORD and understanding of the LORD come to those who walk in obedience by faith to the LORD.
Worthy is Jesus Christ, the LORD, the Lamb of God to receive power, riches, wisdom, strength, honor, glory, and blessing!  Millions of angels are saying this of Jesus Christ.
There is a knowledge and a wisdom from God's Word that comes by the Holy Spirit and not necessarily from formal learning.

Earthly wisdom leads to envy and self-seeking, confusion, and every evil thing. Whereas, heavenly wisdom is pure, peaceable, willing to yield, full of mercy and good fruits, and without partiality or hypocrisy.
Christ-followers should ask God in faith for wisdom because He gives it liberally to all.
Those in Christ are to let God's Word dwell - be at home continually and thoroughly - in them richly (abundantly, profusely) bringing all wisdom.

Spiritual leaders are greatly concerned for those they minister to that (1) their hearts be encouraged due to being knit together in love and (2) attaining all the riches that come from the full assurance of understanding, (3) having the knowledge of the mystery of God, and (4) all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge that are in the LORD.

Intercession for less mature Christ-followers might include the following: (1) be filled with the knowledge of God's will with wisdom and spiritual understanding, (2) walk worthy of the LORD's name with fruit coming out of your good works, and (3) be strengthened by God's power to endure whatever comes with joy.
This can sum up wisdom for right living - hold God in awe and do what He says from a heart of trust.
Those who would grow in wisdom must set their heart to seek wisdom - earnestly, over time.

Christ-followers can intercede for one another by asking God to (1) give them wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him, (2) open their understanding to know God's calling and the riches available to them, and (3) know the exceeding greatness of God's power.

Those who cover their sins rather than confess them fail to prosper due to the fact that their unconfessed sins have brought about a 'clogged communication line' between them and God.  Thus, they don't hear God's guidance, God's rebuke or corrections, or God's wisdom.
Drinking alcoholic beverages can result in a person being led astray from God's wisdom.
God's wisdom and understanding - that which comes from Him to His people - is more valuable than gold or silver.
When God's children build friendships with wise people and spend time with them, God's children gain wisdom.
Those with God's wisdom value rebuke, appreciate being instructed, and increase (all the more) in learning.
Those who obtain God's wisdom have obtained God's favor.
Those in Christ who seek God's wisdom diligently (earnestly) will find it.
Those who have God's wisdom hate pride, arrogance, the evil way, and the perverse mouth.
Those with God's wisdom speak excellent things, right things, and truth.
Keep God's wisdom near your heart at all times.
God's people should take time to think about where they are going and how they will get there - accommodating God's wisdom all along the way.
God's children should seriously pursue God's wisdom - fully embracing it and living accordingly.
Those who walk in God's wisdom and understanding should be generous with those in need who ask.
God's wisdom and understanding are more valuable than anything a person can possess.
The wisdom of God's Word and the awe of God will keep a child of God from entering into an immoral relationship.
God's wisdom will bring to you discretion and understanding.
Those who seek (like treasure hunting) God and His wisdom will come to respect God more and find the awesome knowledge of God.
Those who turned to God and His Word for wisdom God will make known His words to them.
It is foolish to avoid the real wisdom that flows from a dynamic relationship with God and His Word.
God's gifts to His people can be in exceedingly great in supply - wisdom, understanding, and huge (capacity) heart.
God's gifts to one or more of His people can include a gift of wisdom and understanding.
One who is walking in God's wisdom and with God's presence is one in and through whom God will work.

An obedient (by faith) servant of God need not minister the Word with persuasive words based on human wisdom, but minister the Word in a demonstration of the Holy Spirit and of His power that the recipient's faith would be in the power of God.

The declaration of the Gospel (death, burial, and resurrection) of Jesus Christ is a stumbling block to Jews and foolishness to all others, but to the called of God, Christ is the power of God and the wisdom of God.
God calls and gifts men according to His purposes - these men can do for God by God's wisdom what others cannot do.
In times of grief and distress, a Christ-follower can come aside alone with God to find peace, wisdom, and direction.
Those who fear God are beginning to grow in wisdom while good understanding is with those who obey God's Word.
God's wisdom and its fruit comes to those who seek and search for it, applying it as it is found.
Is one thing to gain God's wisdom and understanding, it is another thing to keep a hold of it and keep pursuing more.
The wisdom of God that flows out of a relationship with God and His Word is of great value in this life.
As one's heart increases in intimacy with the LORD, the wisdom from that intimacy will teach his mouth (speech) what to say.
Regardless of a peoples' wisdom, strength, or strategy, God ONLY brings deliverance.
Those would lead God's people desperately need God's wisdom which He grants to the humble who trust in Him.
God's wisdom expressed in and through a Christ-follower has these characteristics: (1) pure, (2) peaceable, (3) gentle, (4) submissive, (5) merciful service, (6) impartial, and (7) sincere.
To fear (hold in awe and respect) God is 'wisdom' and departing from evil is 'understanding.'
The Lamb of God who became the Lion of the tribe of Judah is exalted to receive (1) power,(2) riches, (3) wisdom, (4) strength, (5) honor, (6) glory, and (7) blessing.
God's wisdom is good, profitable, a defense, and it gives life to those who exercise it.
On this earth old all come to death and the wisdom of simple, poor people will be despised or forgotten.
Wisdom from God, dedication, and integrity lived out by a Christ-follower affords him or her the opportunity (when presented) to point others to God and His salvation.
The gift of a word of wisdom or word of knowledge is the spiritual illumination brought by the Spirit of God.
The Spirit gives to some a word of wisdom or a word of knowledge for the profit of the body of Christ to which the 'word' was given.
People know when wisdom and mighty works are coming from one filled with God's Spirit.
A disciples of Jesus is responsible to God to be faithfully applying to his or her assignment ALL that God has given them - spiritual gifts, education, wisdom, skills, experience.
Spiritual leaders pray with a burden for new believers in key locations - asking God to fill them with the knowledge of His will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding.

Those disciples who are filled with the knowledge of God's will with wisdom and spiritual understanding are in the position to walk worthy of the LORD, fully pleasing God, and being fruitful in every good work - while increasing all the more in the knowledge of God.
The aim of proclaiming Christ - warning and teaching every follower of Christ in all wisdom - is to present each one complete (fully mature) in Christ.

Spiritual leaders and disciple makers have a great burden for those they lead: (1) to see them have real 'heart' courage, (2) to be knit together in love, and (3) to experience all the riches of understanding and knowledge of their relationship to God and to Christ - in whom are found all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.
There is a wisdom that comes from God.
God's wisdom is revealed to His chosen one's by the Holy Spirit.
Jesus taught God's Word with wisdom from 'above.'
Jesus exercised heavenly wisdom in choosing times to confront or rebuke others.
Jesus applied with God's wisdom the Scriptures to men's questions.
Jesus submitted to His earthly parents as He grew (increased) in wisdom and in favor with God and men.
Jesus may say things - lead in directions - that go against conventional wisdom.
The wisdom with which Jesus taught was heavenly in origin and also comprised common sense at times - divided kingdom falls.
Jesus' acts were full of God's knowledge, wisdom, and timing.
The truth and wisdom of God in Jesus are utterly profound.
One who knows what Jesus has said is obligated under 'wisdom' to put what Jesus said into practice.
Obeying Jesus is real wisdom.
Wisdom provides a solid base on which to build all else.
Wisdom provides for those who have it.
Wisdom is attractive.
Those with wisdom get wiser with rebukes and instruction.
Those with wisdom are teachable.
Wisdom to my soul is like honey to my taste.
There is hope for the future when one realizes he's growing in God's wisdom.
The thing a disciples longs for will not be lost (cut down) when he walks in God's wisdom - applying God's wisdom.
It is the responsibility of spiritual elders to pass their God-given wisdom on to younger spiritual leaders - the next generation.
The wisdom from God leads His people to have a proper view of coming needs which motivates them to action.
The greatest mystery is known in the fact that God in His fullness is revealed in Jesus Christ - as well as the treasures of wisdom and knowledge are in Christ Jesus.
Worldly' wisdom will grow vain and come to nothing.
God enables people to see with eyes of wisdom.
Wisdom, knowledge, and strength will be present among those who in awe lift up God on High.
Knowledge, wisdom, understanding, prudence, and discretion are learned.
Those who despise wisdom and instruction are fools - thoughtless.
There is a call for wisdom in this world.
Wisdom from God is available through a relationship with Christ.
Those return to God for wisdom will receive it.
Those who disdain counsel and wisdom from God will encounter calamity and destruction.
God's children who earnestly seek from Him wisdom and understanding will receive such.
Walking uprightly with the LORD is intricately connected to wisdom and understanding from the LORD.
Following God's wisdom keeps one from the evil, evil people, and evil ways.
Those who apply wisdom, walking in righteousness, will dwell in God's presence - remaining or abiding in the LORD.
The wisdom and understanding that come from God through applying God's Word are most valuable.
Happiness, gain, and honor come to those who have God's wisdom and understanding.
Wisdom and understanding our tree of life to those who apply the same.
Practicing daily godly wisdom brings peace, discretion, and confidence.
Parents of the responsibility to instruct their children in the wisdom and understanding that comes from God.
The getting of wisdom and understanding are the principal things to get in this life in Christ.
One in Christ will do well to obtain wisdom and understanding.
Children would do well to learn from godly parents - learn wisdom and receive instruction.
Godly wisdom brings quality to life.
Parents must intentionally train their children in godly wisdom and instruction.
Godly wisdom and understanding lead to the exercise of discretion.
Spiritual leaders need to be filled with the Spirit of wisdom in order to lead God's people.
People of God need to listen to a leader who is filled with the Spirit of wisdom.
A humble and wise leader asks God for wisdom and knowledge to lead.
Leadership of God's people demands wisdom from God.
God will grant wisdom to His appointed leaders who from a sincere heart ask it of Him.
God may bless those with great wisdom so that they accumulate much.
People want to hear from one who has godly wisdom.
Leadership reigns of men with great wisdom, vast wealth, and huge accomplishments come to an end.
People will recognize and appreciate those who evidence godly wisdom.
Worldly wisdom and God's grace are in contrast to each other.
God's good news shared in human wisdom - with wise and clever words -  divest it of its power.
Christ-followers should pray for one another that God will fill them with the knowledge of His will through all spiritual wisdom and understanding.
Man's wisdom is not the basis for the Christ-life message.
God's wisdom in the life of a Christ-follower will show and will make a difference.
God's people need a leader that lives and expresses God's wisdom.
God can give a leader wisdom, insight, and understanding.
Any Christ-follower lacking wisdom should ask God for wisdom.
God will give wisdom to the one who actually trusts God to give it.
A teacher's message is made of words taught by God's Spirit not words taught by human wisdom.
Wisdom (wise living) coming from heaven is pure, peace-loving, considerate, submissive, full of mercy and good fruit, impartial and sincere.
Wisdom originating with the devil and of this world is self-centered and unspiritual, resulting in envy, confusion, and all kinds of evil practices.
The people of God need to seek God for wisdom in making decisions.
God can bless His servants with wisdom and success.
Helping others mature involves preaching Christ, admonishing, and teaching with all wisdom.
God gives grace, wisdom, and power to His people to accomplish His purposes through them.
Wisdom, tact and cleverness are virtues believers should exercise.
Godly leaders are aware of how to use wisdom and tact in confronting criticism.
With the Word dwelling richly in the teacher's life, the teacher can minister with all wisdom.
Fools despise wisdom and discipline.
As one begins to recognize God, knowledge and wisdom are not far behind.
God's wisdom beckons to all people.
God's wisdom is not hidden.
God's wisdom can be found.
When God's wisdom is applied in life, it makes simpleminded people gain prudence and the foolish gain understanding.
God's wisdom is always true and valuable for life.
God's wisdom shows a person to detest wickedness.
Gaining wisdom is more valuable than any amount of money.
There is nothing a believer can desire that can compare to wisdom.
A truly wise person continues to increase in wisdom.
Wisdom from Heaven is wholesome and pure.
Wisdom is also peace loving and considerate.
In addition, wisdom is submissive, full of mercy, and good fruit as well as impartial and sincere.
Heavenly wisdom is to be lived out in a believer's life each day.
Those who embrace God's wisdom will be blessed - are fortunate.
Knowing and applying God's wisdom is of more value than silver or gold.
As a matter of fact, nothing is more valuable than applying God's wisdom.
Life with honor, peace, and riches is characteristic of the believer who lives God's wisdom.
Meaningful life is a benefit of living God's wisdom.
The education and wisdom of the world does not lead a person to faith in Jesus Christ.
Godly words of wisdom should be put to memory by the upcoming generation.
A man who loves wisdom brings joy to his father.
A man who loves wisdom brings joy to his father because he won't waste his life or wealth on immoral women.
Children should be trained to accept learning and wisdom all their days.
A man who gains wisdom is first one who fears the LORD.
God's vast (infinite) wisdom and knowledge is also deeper than one could ever fathom.
Jesus has perfect wisdom and perfect judgment.
Jesus the Lamb is worthy of receiving power, wealth, wisdom, strength, honor, glory, and praise.
God is unique, great, King, true, living, everlasting, Creator, wisdom, speaking, sustains the universe, LORD of host while idols are none of this.
To live with wisdom and life is better than living with folly and darkness.
Without interactions with God, men of wisdom and men of folly live in vain.
Better is poor with wisdom than riches with foolishness.
Human understanding and wisdom vary in degrees among men, but always falls short of God's wisdom.
Wisdom (the application of knowledge to real-life circumstances) is very valuable in this life.
An indiscretion or inappropriate behavior by those respected for wisdom and honor ruins them.
During one's life, it would be best to (1) trust and obey God and (2) learn knowledge and wisdom from God-oriented man.
God is the source of wisdom and understanding.
The wisdom and understanding that comes from God is more valuable than gold, silver, or precious stones.
God created nature with His wisdom, power, and creativity.
Since Christ-followers don't know the exact time of the DAY, Christ-followers are to be spiritually alert (paying attention) - praying for wisdom and insight daily.

It is essential as a believing disciple of Jesus Christ to (1) know for certain Jesus is the Son of God, (2) sent by God into the world as Savior (3) believing and receiving the words and teachings of Jesus as God's Word, Truth, (4) believing God 'sourced' the life and ministry of Jesus - direction, power, healings, riasing the dead, ruling over nature, victory over sin, wisdom in all Scripture, and (5) keeping a hold on God's Word (a recepticle to believe and apply God's Word).
Even the wisdom apart from Godly wisdom can see moral corruption in others.

It will be critically important for Christ-followers living in pagan or idolatrous cultures to exercise God-given wisdom in making appeals to obtain the right or opportunity to alternative (to the culture) choices or actions.
Those IN CHRIST who wholeheartedly seek wisdom and knowledge in the midst of a dark culture go to Him who has the Light and who grants revelation (lifting off of the cover).

Those Christ-followers God is using among an idolatrous culture - even serving the government - may be promoted to very high ranking positions due to the wisdom, character, and revelation(s) given them by God.

The Word of God is given by God and taught by the Spirit of God and men of God to be applied by faith in everyday life in order to experience God\'s abundant life as well as receiving wisdom and understanding (observable by outsiders as such) - so, pay attention to God\'s Word, diligently practice it, and pass it on to the next generation.
The Word of God is THE SOURCE above all sources for wisdom and understanding.

Recognize there are in the body of Christ those who are more spiritually mature - those gifted by the Spirit with more spiritual wisdom and understanding - whose counsel should be sought when faced with difficult decisions or choices.

The one in the body of Christ who thinks he can make the right choices apart from seeking greater spiritual wisdom and understanding from those gifted so by God\'s Spirit is thinking presumptuously - such is a danger to himself and others.
A husband and wife are to look to the LORD for His love and wisdom to sustain and enhance their marriage - by His Spirit and in His ways.
A Christ-follower in an intimate relationship with the LORD gains wisdom on living as God grants him a clearer view of the brevity of his life in view of eternity.
Godly wisdom is made known by God to the \'inner man\' of those IN CHRIST and yielded to God.
With the Word and wisdom of Scripture, a spiritual leader can be of more value than simply preaching and praying.
Those who value (maximize) their days (realizing the brevity of days) gain a heart of wisdom.
Those who would lead God\'s people need to be full of God\'s Spirit and the wisdom He produces to apply God\'s Word in daily life.
Those sent by God \"behind enemy lines\" for His purposes must go by faith and interact - using the wisdom of the Spirit - with those they encounter.
The Word of God and leadership (wisdom) of the Spirit of God delivered by Spirit-filled and Spirit-led spiritual leaders strengthens the Christ-followers who receive them as from God.
Knowing God and applying His Word in life brings that one wisdom and understanding.
Real wisdom and understanding come through God\'s Word - believe it, meditate on it, and apply it.
Sometimes God\'s grace or favor manifests as wisdom - practical wisdom - in those chosen so by God.
The root words of God sending a Savior to His people goes back into Genesis, Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers, and Deuteronomy.
What boldness (how assuring) one can have recognizing (by God's grace) your assigned 'life message' aligns rightly with the Scriptures - Law, Prophets, Psalms.
The Psalmist and writer of Hebrews are led to present Jesus Christ as deity; Son of God and King of righteousness.
The Psalmist speaks of Jesus who is (1) Ruler (King of kings) and (2) Priest (High Priest).
Jesus not only gives credence to the Psalms as Scripture, but points out the Psalmists were at times writing about Him.
Brings me to think again about Psalm 1 - tree by the river and it's fruit bearing.
The psalmist David knew and wrote about righteousness by faith, apart from works.
The Book of Psalms has prophetic value and accuracy.
Resurrection beyond the grave was taught in the Psalms through David.

What the temple in Jerusalem was to those under the Abrahamic covenant, so the heart - inner man, soul and more specifically the spirit - is to those under the new covenant of the body and blood of Jesus Christ: (1) 12:5, the place God makes His name to dwell, a holy place and meeting place, John 4:23, 14:23; Ephesians 1:13-14, (2) 12:11, the place God makes His name abide, where the character of Christ is formed and reflected, Galatians 4:19, 5:22-23, (3) 12:18, the place we receive, recognize, and rejoice over all God has given us, a depository of spiritual and heavenly communiques, 2 Peter 1:1-5, (4) 12:21, the place to exercise gratitude in enjoying and expressing all God has provided, gratitude 1 Thessalonians 5:18, (glory) 1 Corinthians 10:31, humility James 4:6, within the boundary of His Word Colossians 3:16; 2 Timothy 3:16-17, Psalm 119:9-16, (5) 12:26, the place reserved for holiness (clean) and offerings (service of self and giftings) to the LORD from a motive of love toward God, Mark 12:28-30; Romans 12:1; Acts 13:22 (example).
Those who call on the LORD in trust (for salvation) will have their sins cleansed away, be baptized, and serve the LORD.
When one puts faith in and surrender (with corresponding action) on Jesus Christ, the LORD affirms 'salvation has come' to this one.
Those who are IN God's great salvation and atonement should give Him (1) thanks forever and (2) show praise to God in all generations.
The LORD may come personally to some He is granting grace and faith for salvation as well as His purposes.
Some who hear a more WIDE picture of following Christ in salvation may express fear or rejecting of God's Word.
Christ-followers should be able to tell THEIR story of a personal encounter with the LORD Jesus Christ in salvation.
Those who are forgiven much by the LORD and His salvation (forgiveness) are the ones who love Him much - and, oh how He loves them!
Is the basic call of God at salvation, 'I want you to be a minister (servant) and witness both of what you have seen and what will be revealed to you?'

God has sent His salvation and deliverance (eternal life in Jesus Christ and rightened relationship with Himself) to all; Jews and Gentiles - the Gentiles being granted by God a huge open door (receptivity).

The size of one's SHIELD OF FAITH is proportionate to the (1) knowledge / assurance of his / her salvation (place in Christ) and the (2) working knowledge of Scripture (the amount of and ability to apply in life).

Spiritual leaders should constantly affirm to Christ-followers (1) God's complete salvation in Jesus Christ, (2) maintain good works, and (3) avoid foolish disputes, divisions and those involved in such.
Jesus is invisible God made visible to reveal God's salvation to those who believe.

Christ-followers should hold to God alone when attacked or oppressed because He alone is (1) unmovable, (2) trustworthy, (3) refuge, (4) attentive, (5) salvation / deliverance, (6) powerful, and (7) merciful.
Christ-followers should remember the deliverance and salvation God has given them.

Those who have experienced God\'s deliverance and salvation - even once - ought to fall in love with the LORD for the mercy He extended to them.
God, Himself, is the strength “in and of” salvation for all IN CHRIST.
God\'s decisions and choices exercised through His mercy, grace, and election for the salvation of men are beyond human comprehension.

Ruth\'s story clearly reveals God\'s mercy and grace are extended to the cursed or otherwise excluded peoples of the world that they may be received into God\'s family - redemption and salvation by grace.
Oh that followers of Christ would have a burden for God\'s peace - salvation in Christ - for Israel.
Because the family table (meals) is shared by disciples, family members also connect - wives, sons, daughters, etc.
Alms and offerings are our God-led mercy gifts to those (first family of God, then others) in need.
Christ-followers are to diligently avoid planting or spreading discouragement among others in God's family.
Those in Christ are blessed with friends and family IN CHRIST with whom to share some of life's most challenging moments.
Some are born and raised in God's family who have great abilities compared to the population.
A loving, loyal, enterprising wife is a blessing to her family and beyond.
God's 'promised rest' (eternal salvation in God's family) is entered by faith in His powerful, living Word (not by endeavors / works) and experienced with help from Him who grants mercy and grace.
So much of God's promises or inheritance to His people Israel are on a national or family level whereas with Christ-followers it is on a personal or individual level.

Christ-followers are living spiritual beings (spiritually alive), members of God's spiritual family or household, and called to offer up spiritual sacrifices (obedience to God's will in the Spirit) which God accepts through Christ Jesus (our example).
Let God build your life and family; guarding you and yours while giving you rest.
There are those who will band together to annihilate God's nation or family of Israel form the earth - Islamic peoples and nations have made public this declaration.
A family, a city, or a nation would do well to put their trust and obedience in the LORD, His might and His way.

Sometimes family members - those around whom one grew up - may say things and act in ways to let one of theirs (a Christ-follower) know they think he or she has lost their mind - become obsessed with this 'following Jesus thing.'
Those in Christ make up the family of God - brothers and sisters to Jesus Christ and children of God.
All who believe God's Word and trust in Christ - though former slaves under the law - are adopted by God into His family and given His Spirit - all such now can know God as Abba, Father.
Religious (but unsaved) leaders with high positions may even jeopardize those positions if necessary to come in faith to Jesus Christ for saving the life of a beloved family member.

Sometimes God's assignment or mission for a newly born one - recently saved and set free - is to go to his or her family and acquaintances to tell them what the LORD has done and let them see the changes He can make.
Those who do God's will (believe and obey God) are members of the family of the LORD - brothers and sisters of the LORD Jesus Christ.
Fellow disciples of Jesus pursue spending time with one another - especially with a strong, well known one such as Paul - with family members, too, as much as possible.
Man without a strong God-focus will crumble into depression when he is confronted with huge personal, family, and business struggles or losses.
A few intellectually elite will believe the Gospel of Jesus Christ and become part of the family of God.

God has His eye out for key men and women He wishes to pour mercy and grace upon AND He sends to them a faithful witness with His Scripture to bring them into His forever family and SPREAD the Gospel to other nations.

God's design for marriage is that a man and wife love each other and have mutual respect for each other as people while fulfilling two distinct roles - husband is head of the family with honor for his wife and the wife submits to her husband and respects him.
Christ-followers sent out as messengers to spread the Gospel are to look for a 'family of peace' with which to connect as a 'base of sharing (of operation)' the Gospel in that place.
A leader of God's people doing God's will must encourage the people when being attacked to trust in God, avoid being fearful, and fight with your family and friends in mind.
Those going out to heal the sick and preach the kingdom of God are to look for a 'man (or family) of peace' in whatever area they go.
Jesus refers to those who believe and become disciples as members of His family.
The children God grants a Christ-following family are a gracious gift from Him and will be a blessing to experience in the years to come.
Being born again of God is essential for becoming a member of God's forever family - the kingdom of God, the place where God reigns.
A person doesn't simply decide one day he or she wants to become a child of God, but must be born of God to be in God's family.
Members of God's forever family are to continue to love one another.
God calls whom He chooses - not from any particular peoples, family, sect or background - to hear Him and speak His words.
Christ-followers would do well to 'Barnabas' others in the family of God - to Barnabas one is to encourage them by helping them find their place in God's family and service.
There are Gentiles in God's family - many who have come to God by faith.
Experiencing God's new birth in Christ can transform us from be unprofitable to profitable as far as service in God's family or kingdom.

Those in Christ must contend for the faith - its truth in its earliest form - because some men will creep in among the family of God to turn God's grace into lewdness and deny (reject as LORD) our LORD and the LORD Jesus Christ.
It is God who determines our role in His family and kingdom - gifting us for the role He assigns us.
Some relationships in the family of God are so special that daily intercession (thoughtful intercession) by name is the routine.
Ministry assignments are the choice (will of) of God for each one in the family of God.
All in Christ are members of God's household, God's family.
The holy temple in which God resides today by His Spirit is none other than the family of God.
The heart of those in God's family who have understanding seek more knowledge and understanding.
Men in God's family are to love the wife of their youth - rejoicing before God for such a gift as she.

All those who trust in the LORD have righteousness imputed to their account and form a family of faith in line with Abraham - whose faith in God before circumcision brought his righteous standing with God.
Those in God's family who commit adultery pay a high price which includes damaging his own soul, wounds to himself and others, dishonoring himself, and become a reproach from now on.
Each Christ-follower should  have their vocation - work, employment, means of a living - so to meet their family's financial needs.
Christ-followers are not to desire titles (like teacher, father, rabbi, etc.), but be satisfied to live as brothers in God's family.

Upon hearing how God had chosen to bless this family (and by faith the word is received), one 'after God's own heart' takes time to go SIT BEFORE GOD to meditate on God's grace, humbling and sovereign grace.
Those who are lost (unsaved, not born into God's family, dead in sins) are of real concern to God - and He pursues them.
God cares about the simple, practical needs of people - especially those in His family and those who are in the audience coming close to His family.
Christ-followers are to be a forgiving, mercy-granting family toward all those who ask for forgiveness.
Those who truly love another may find a way to show it to the family even after the death of the one loved.
Give to others what is due them from you (friends, family, government, whatever), and also give to God what is due Him.
Christ-followers are the family of God.

The family of God should be excited with renewed relationships between family members.
When others (outside God's family) see and hear how God supernaturally worked to move His people forward, a fear of God (respect and awe) is established.
Death of family members (loved ones) must be seen in light of the sovereignty of God - not so much that God is punishing or bringing suffering, but life is in His hands.

Those in God's family should not take financial advantage of each other, but treat each other with respect.

The most orthodox of God's family (strictest in interpreting the Scriptures) may have a really hard time opening up to accept new work or word from God.
God puts a high value on 'family' in His family.
It is not right to ignore blatant sin by a person or family among God's people.
In Acts 9:15 we read where God gave apostle Paul a calling to go to the Gentiles - here Peter acknowledges God's clearing the way for Gentiles to be part of God's family.
How precious are the 'Barnabas' people in the family of God who deliberately encourage others - net-working with them to introduce them to the larger body of Christ.

Christ-followers are priests unto God; called to serve Him and to bless others in God's family.
Mighty men and ordinary men have their place in God's family.

Those who are children of God by faith in Jesus connect directly to God's family by new birth.

God chooses a people to make them a family - His family.
God's plan includes people of many nations coming by faith into His family.

Those who have believed and are in God's family (1) are chosen, (2) are in ministry, (3) are a separated people, and (4) are God's own special people - Why? So these same Christ-followers can declare praise to God because He called them out of darkness to walk in His marvelous light.
God is so concerned about the heart condition of those who are born into His family.
The elect in Christ Jesus are as a family - love one another, kiss one another, and encourage one another.
God is the source of all grace to His children and the One who called us into His family and service.

Judgment - tried by fire - has come to those in God's family.

Those who walk in the light are conscious of how they use their time - buying up every opportunity because the days are becoming more and more evil.
Though we work to keep the unity found in the person and work of the Holy Spirit, we each differ because of the free spiritual gifts of differing measure given us through Christ.

Christ-followers are called to be spiritually alert at all times on all days in all seasons - not giving the enemy an opportunity.

The character of a follower of Christ is to include humble and gentle, longsuffering, (suffering long), and bearing with one another in love - endeavoring (working at it) to keep the unity that comes by God's Spirit in the bond of peace.
No occasion is to rob from a disciple of Jesus his or her opportunity to rejoice in being IN THE LORD.
Mature disciples are to be committed to the assignment God has given them - singularly focused, looking forward, and pressing on together with others in unity.

Christ-followers should testify of the LORD to others when given an opportunity.
There will only be one opportunity to enter the kingdom.
Disciples must be on alert at all times because the enemy is looking for an opportunity to attack.
When God's people are not following God there will be a tendency among them to experience division, disunity, quarreling, and jealousy.
A bishop or overseer is to be of solid Christ-like character, of healthy relationships in his family, and of good reputation in the community.
God gives disobedient children a demonstration of His power and an opportunity to repent.
The church is to be the pillar of truth to its surrounding community.
When God sends an opportunity to repent, one needs to repent.
The LORD gives opportunity for those to whom He ministers to accept Him.
God puts Christ-followers in settings where they have the opportunity to trust Him.
Therefore, - because evil pervades today's society - Christ-followers are to make the most of every opportunity.
When a group of believers are filled with the Spirit, they experience the highest level of oneness or unity of heart and mind.
Sharing, cooperation, and unity are characteristics of a Spirit-filled group of believers.
An encourager is one who gives another opportunity to one who fell short last time.
A witness should give an opportunity to the unbeliever to make a commitment to Christ.
Believers must be ready to share the Scriptures and the gospel when the opportunity is hot.
It is wise to teach about God and Christ first to the most influential people in a community.
Believers (especially spiritual leaders) have an opportunity to make other believers stronger in the faith.
When people are disobedient to God, God has the opportunity to exercise His mercy.
The LORD awaits the opportunity to enter again a lukewarm church.
Sometimes it's too late to obey - the opportunity is missed.
Those who serve God can live out among the people in the community.
Got may give one more opportunity for His rebellious people to repent, but be sure judgment is just around the corner.
God may exercise the opportunity to bring His rebellious people down to where they have nothing and nowhere to turn but to Him.
The transitioning "out" leader of God's people should have an opportunity to bless God's people into the future.
Life, ministry, and labor are best experienced as a team or community in contrast to going it alone.
God gives men an opportunity to repent and be restored.

Those who say things or do things which disrupt, sow discord, or break up unity among brothers in Christ commit a sin against God and man - because such words and actions work against what God's Spirit is producing, unity in the body of Christ.
The position of bishop requires proven character and ability to get along with people - in one's family, the assembly, and the community - and proven skill to teach.
Those whose actions hurt, break, or damage relationships (among those experiencing unity) in the body of Christ are working against God's will.
The body of Christ is to be a 'loving-each-other' community.
Jesus (at God's right hand) and the Holy Spirit (sent to each disciple) provide each disciple the perfect ASK opportunity.

The local assemblies of Christ-followers are to have multiple, appointed spiritual leaders who meet the qualifications and engage in carrying out their responsibilities: Qualifications are God-honoring character applied and proven in the family and community and Responsibilities of (1) knowing God's Word and its application in life, (2) teach soundly the Word of God so the people of God can grow in Christ-likeness, interact as Christ-followers, and engage in good works, (3) promote the Gospel of grace and new birth by the Holy Spirit, and (4) protect against divisiveness in the assembly.
Those who have received life-impacting mercy and grace from God have a keen opportunity to surrender the rest of their life under His Lordship.

Christ-followers are to let God\'s Word impact (1) their personal life day and night, (2) their family life (at the core of many daily discussions), (3) their vocation and service to others, (4) their thoughts and decisions - how they see life, and (5) their going out into the community and the relationships they have with all who know them.

Those IN CHRIST walking in an intimate relationship with the LORD, even in an idolatrous culture, will recognize a God-appointed opportunity, courageously declare God\'s revelation (Truth), and point gloriously to God as their Source.
Those faithful to and in close relationship with God in an idolatrous culture recognize and take opportunity to speak truth about God.

It will be critically important for Christ-followers living in pagan or idolatrous cultures to exercise God-given wisdom in making appeals to obtain the right or opportunity to alternative (to the culture) choices or actions.

As a community of Christ-followers, there is sharing of and a rejoicing in the harvest of all who participated in the work as well as those who benefited from the harvest (what was \"brought in\") - all of which brings them to remember God\'s salvation, guidance, and provision.

Even a relatively forgotten, quite elderly, faithful servant of God in an idolatrous culture may be given an opportunity to speak again for God in public (maybe at the highest level) and by God\'s grace do so with boldness, truth, revelation, and humility.
Those in the LORD living among idolaters take opportunity to \'identify\' with others in the LORD.

An act of disobedience or rebellion followed later by a desire to obey may be a delay that thrust the people of God OUT OF GOD\'S TIMING - a missed opportunity and God is not now involved in the circumstances.
God would have His people group together to experience community IN CHRIST while touching broader society to reveal CHRIST to them.
When God provides for you abundantly, it is your opportunity to be generous with others.
In a day of celebration among God's people, those 'with' are encouraged to share what they have with those 'without.'
The news of God's destruction of some wicked nations - who have brought havoc to many - will result in celebrations.
God's people need to remember, with humility and celebration, the deliverance was brought by God.
Disciples anticipate sharing in celebrations with their mentor.
Celebration and thanksgiving by God's people follows recognition of His awesome work.
Celebration on a holy day can be SO right before God.
Christ-followers must have times of celebration and feast in gratitude to God for His work among them.
Appointing of a new spiritual leader should be a celebration - toward God.
Renewal of the people can bring renewal of worship which can result in renewal of celebration toward God.
Some celebrations by God's people picture events that will happen in the future.
Some celebrations by Christ-followers related to honoring God will be loud.
A celebration day can be a day of rest from regular work.
There are certainly to be times of gathering (church) of God's people in full celebration.
Spiritual leaders need to know the right days for celebration and giving of mercy.
Corporate worship and celebration can bring joy and blessing to all who participate.
There can be a celebration when one is called into service by God.
There will be a celebration in heaven involving the Lamb of God and those in love with Him.
The annual remembrance and celebration of personal salvation should involve a sacred gathering of like-hearted and like-minded children of God.

Christ\'s servants, who upon completion of an assignment or ministry (regardless of apparent magnitude, outcome, or acclaim), should not seek accolades, celebrations, or special compensation - but, simply acknowledge from the heart, \"We did our duty unto Christ.\"
God can put gladness (joy, satisfaction) in one's heart (those trusting, looking solely to Him) regardless of circumstances.
Whether in trouble or enjoying all life, a submissive heart toward the LORD is the best and proper position to have.
One day enjoying God's presence is better than a thousand other days.
There are times when wholehearted, intense emotions (shouts of joy, loud weeping with deep joy) are expressed by those who witness God at work - immediately before their eyes.
God can SO GRACE His people (even delivering from annihilation) filling them with light, joy, gladness, and honor as to produce an evangelistic outbreak - many coming to faith in the LORD.
Men should make the most of (including enjoyment) the life (the work, people, culture, education) given them by God - it is a gift.
Christ-followers should enjoy, experience, and declare EVERYDAY (1) God's mercy new every morning and (2) God's faithfulness sure every evening.
Those in close, strong relationship with the LORD find taking in His Word brings joy and rejoicing to their heart.
Those whose trust is resting in God are a satisfied and joyous people.
Those in Christ get to enjoy the 'first fruits' of life in the Spirit in this life and much more in the life to come.
The Holy Spirit in a Christ-follower produces love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, and self-control.
Regardless of what difficulties or tribulations await a faithful, Spirit-filled servant of the LORD, he should be driven internally by the Spirit to 'finish my race with joy.'
Those in Christ who make a living - working with their hands - know the responsibility and joy of giving to meet the needs of the weak.
Those who walk in the Spirit live a life like Jesus (God with you) which is an attractive life - others wanting your peace, joy, love, etc.
God takes joy in and extends mercy to establish a small remnant of faithful followers when the majority of those who carry His name disobey.
Since Christ came to seek the lost, we too are to seek the lost that joy will sound forth in the heavens as new believers repent and trust in Christ.
The deep, deep joy of the LORD adds real strength and hope to those who know and love Him.

When a rebuilding of the corporate life relating to God is underway, you may hear shouts of joy (for the new God is bringing) and weeping aloud (for the older days before God's judgment that preceded the rebuilding) - both have great meaning.

Christ and His followers know that the Holy Spirit enables them to resist the temptations Satan throws at them - but, Christ-followers must be filled with the Holy Spirit to enjoy the enabling power of the Holy Spirit.
God's miracles bring great joy to some - those receiving the miracles - and great fear to others  -those who see such great power displayed.
Knowing how good the joy is going to be enables one to endure the sorrow and difficulties today.
Christ-followers know the joy of the LORD by walking in a love relationship of obedience to Him.
Members of the body of Christ are to be in such relationship with one another as to be able to share with others what is going on inside of them - asking for prayer and singing for joy.

Spiritual leaders can encourage novice believers to consider it joyous overall when trials come, because the testing (putting into use over time) of faith produces patience (spiritual endurance) - which over time leads to becoming mature in Christ.
Doesn't God indeed call us to endure all kinds of opposition and shame here on earth because we walk in Christ knowing one day we will walk forever in joy with Him?
If suffering through trials come because you are following Christ, let this suffering be to the glory of God - joy comes in the morning.
There will come days of judgment to the people of God when the LORD brings destruction, hunger, and lack of joy.
God enjoys to bring glory to His name - even in granting miracles to various ones.

Intercession for less mature Christ-followers might include the following: (1) be filled with the knowledge of God's will with wisdom and spiritual understanding, (2) walk worthy of the LORD's name with fruit coming out of your good works, and (3) be strengthened by God's power to endure whatever comes with joy.
Christ-followers are to be joyful, gentle, and prayerful all along life's way.
The kingdom of God is about (1) obedience to God by faith, (2) peace, and (3) joy in the Holy Spirit - not what food I eat or avoid.
Labor that results in food to eat, houses to enjoy, and places to go may satisfy the body, but will not at all satisfy the soul.
It is a testimony to God's grace when those who work with you and for you really enjoy working with you and for you.
It is a good testimony when your laborers and all those around you enjoy serving you and working for you.
Every Christ-follower should pursue a personal, intimate life in the presence of God - for, in the presence of God is real satisfaction and joy evermore.
Those who are forgiven their sins by God experience real blessing or joy.
God may bring His anger to bear for a brief time for our good, but His favor is toward His covenant people forever - joy is coming in a short time.
Doubting God and His ability to carry you through obeying Him can cost you (at least somewhat) the full enjoyment of what your obedience would have discovered.
Those in Christ who delight in the relationship they enjoy with the LORD will find their (God-fed or induced) desires come to pass.
The inner man is our 'life in Christ' being renewed by the Holy Spirit day by day (to those walking in Christ), whether we are experiencing joys or persecutions, wars or peace.
God's people are holy - that is they are a set-apart people, special, enjoying a dedicated relationship of love and devotion to God and from God.
In God's presence is fullness of joy - real satisfaction and pleasures evermore.
There is great joy where God is at work in redeeming souls and healing people.
God's most precious and joyous blessings to us may also include a sharp pain (they will see John's beheading).
God gives man so very much to enjoy and profit, but restricts man so very little.
Christ-followers should remember their salvation and remember their Savior - firmly, lively, regularly, joyously, and seriously.
God's people are filled with gratitude to God for though His anger visits them shortly (tears for a night) His favor and joy come in the morning.
Those who love the LORD and walk in His ways enjoy fellowship with the LORD.
God's people can enjoy the victory of the enemies or overcoming of obstacles encountered on the way to experiencing God's Word.
Spiritual leaders really enjoy the benefits of sharing intimate fellowship with their disciples.
Sometimes it is better to write ahead a needed 'hard word,' that upon visiting face to face, you find the people received the word and you are greeted with joy.
Those in Christ who are rich in this age (place and time) are to trust in God, enjoy what He has given them, be ready to give, and willing to share with others.
Husbands and wives can value and desire their physical enjoyment - whether simply being in each other's presence or embracing each other.
What man earns through his labor is a gift from God to be enjoyed and used in the fear of God.
It is better to see many things and enjoy them than to see many things and desire them all.
Riches and wealth with the ability to enjoy them are a gift from God.
Those suffering for righteousness can enjoy God's peace.
Christ-followers can consider experiencing trials and temptations a joy since the same will result in increased endurance - which in its full course results in well-rounded maturity.
The greatest obstacle to one coming to Christ may be the thing(s) one likes or enjoys the most.
It is a joyful event when the lost are saved.
Those disciples raising up young disciples ask the LORD to grant the young all patience and longsuffering with joy.
Only those trusting in Christ can suffer long and experience joy in the LORD along the way.
Jesus has joy regarding His chosen ones.
Disciple makers should have joy regarding their disciples.
Jesus desires that His joy in His disciples will remain in them and that the joy experienced by His disciples would be full measure.
Those who believe God in salvation have joy inexpressible in the Christ they cannot see - having received the end of their faith - salvation.
Service to the LORD is to be characterized by righteousness, peace, and joy in the Holy Spirit.
Real joy and gladness are received from God, Who is the true source thereof.
The kingdom of God is righteousness, peace, and joy in the Holy Spirit.
The joy and gladness of experiencing  God's grace is greater by far than the earthbound happiness of material success.
(15) enjoy life - live a full life.
Joyous praise from God's upright is beautiful to Him.
God's blessings to His people are to be enjoyed by them however or wherever.
That which the Spirit of God produces in a disciple of Jesus is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, and self-control.
Leaders who work hard at developing others get to enjoy first those being developed.
Be prepared to answer outsiders when they ask about you - your love, joy, and peace.
A leader who engages in developing future leaders reaps the benefit of enjoying in leadership those who first come up into leadership.
Disciples of Jesus are to be people of joy and rejoicing.
The one who walks in righteousness does not enjoy watching evil.
Spiritual leaders should frequent and enjoy fellowship in the homes of disciples.
A consistent testimony or character of joy is valuable.
Faithful, excellent work done with real joy may open a door in a day of need.
Renewal with God brings joy from the Lord which gives strength.
God intends for His people to enjoy the blessings He has given them.
God's blessings to His people are to be enjoyed by them however or wherever.
Those who enjoy God's presence are blessed.
What joy comes to those who know by experience God answers their prayers.
Gladness and joy are known by those who live in God's presence.
Those who seek God with a whole heart and pure heart will enjoy His presence.
topics: Whole heart, pure heart, enjoy, God's presence

results.text: Those with a heart for God may endure weeping for a night, but joy will come in the morning.
Oh, the privilege, joy, and grace extended to see the LORD.
Joy in heart and praise to God comes to a leader who sees his people follow his good example.
Passionate, willing giving by leaders will prompt joy and enthusiasm among all the people.
It ought to bring great joy to those working under a godly leader.
What joy it is to have peace and fellowship with God.
Joyous shouting and humble bowing may follow God manifesting His glory.
Instead, spiritual leaders give direction and instructions in order that their people know the joy of the Christ-life.
Those who experience the joy of getting right with God don't regret rebukes.
Christ-followers experiencing severe trial and extreme poverty can experience overflowing joy as they share with others in need.
Sometimes when a spiritual leader revisits after an absence there is great joy and happiness.
The people of God know the joy of tears associated with seeing God work.
God can restore His people to experience the fullness of joy and rejoicing.
When the reality of consequences sets in and the joy of mankind withers away.
God's full blessing produces new life, joy that flows, and an enthusiasm that is effervescent.
The righteous will enjoy eternal life with the LORD.
Corporate worship and celebration can bring joy and blessing to all who participate.
Those who have been helped by God jump for joy and thank God in song sometimes.
God is also able to present each Christ-followers before Himself without fault and with great joy.
Relationships between disciple-makers (spiritual leaders) and those discipled can be so strong that tears are experienced when one departs and the expectation of being filled with joy upon reuniting.
Christ-followers can face trials with pure joy if they realize proving one's faith develops perseverance.
Christ-followers are to enjoy the things God provides.
Those who know God and obey Him can enjoy His presence.
When people discover God's kingdom, the joy they experience will likely cause them to readily let go of the things that once filled their life.
Jesus Christ endured the cross and scorned it's shame for the joy set before Him - He sat down at the right hand of the throne of God.
Christ-followers must endure the temporary for the joy of sharing in the eternal.
Today Christ-followers come to life, joy, the Spirit, Christ, and to the sprinkled blood of Christ.
These characteristics in a Christ-follower's life are produced by the Holy Spirit:  love, joy, peace, patience, gentleness, goodness, faithfulness, meekness, self-control.
When Christ-followers are submissive the work of the leader brings joy.
One who is in the LORD and enjoying the fellowship and relationship of that position can be rejoicing.
He who hates ill-gotten gain will enjoy a long life.
Those who have experienced God's salvation and forgiveness know joy and gladness.
Joy comes to those who believe in Jesus Christ.
A man who loves wisdom brings joy to his father because he won't waste his life or wealth on immoral women.
A man who loves wisdom brings joy to his father.
The filling of the Holy Spirit and being filled with joy are common experiences for new converts to the gospel.
Even though the circumstances of life are less than great, believers can have joy because of their hope in the future.
Those working in or around where God is at work find joy in that service.
Oh, the joy of anticipating God's grace being poured out!
In the presence of God are found strength and joy.
People deceived by sin consider only the enjoyable aspects or surroundings of their sinful experiences.
It is a deep, heart joy to receive the words of God - to hear from the LORD.
God wants His people to have and enjoy His best.
God has a state of blessing planned for His people - even after rebelling against Him - He will bring the blessing, joy, and honor according to His plan.
The promise land is not heaven when I die" but God's provision of the Spirit-filled life of obedience NOW - with the rest, joy, inheritance now and then.
By God's grace, the man who labors may eat and enjoy the rewards of his work.
Those who gain great riches in wealth with their daily enjoyments do so as a gift from God.

Earthly riches are entrusted to - put in the stewardship of - some in Christ SO they can (1) enjoy the riches, (2) do (fund) kingdom (good) works, (3) give away some riches, and (4) willingly share some riches with others - such stewardship of riches will precede them into their inheritance in heaven.
All things which Christ-followers possess are gifts richly and ceaselessly provided by God to be enjoyed.

There is a great joy to be experienced and owned by disciples of Jesus who come to know (1) He lives eternally at God's right hand and (2) all the promises (Word and words) of Jesus and Father are true.

Because Jesus is at God's right hand and because the Holy Spirit reveals truth, guides, and speaks (tells) heavenly messages to disciples of Jesus, disciples of Jesus may ask the Father "whatever" IN ALL JESUS IS and the Father will indeed grant those requests SO THAT the joy and delight in the heart of the disciples comes to full measure (fills up, completed).

Those Christ-followers who remain in an intimate love relationship with the Father (1) bearing much fruit, (2) asking and receiving, (3) doing what the LORD says, and (4) glorifying the Father will experience a joy like Jesus experienced in relation to the Father.

Those who are in an intimate daily walk with the LORD doing what He says out of a love relationship (1) are to express a servant heart toward others in the body of Christ, (2) express love to others in the body of Christ, (3) experience ever-more open communication with the LORD, (4) are taught and guided by the Holy Spirit, (5) will experience peace in a troublesome and antagonistic world, (6) will bear much fruit, (7) experience ever-increasing joy, (8) and IN CHRIST experience overcoming (to prevail, to conquer, victorious) the world.
Once a follower of Jesus experiences Jesus alive (revelation of Jesus) and a confirmation of His promised Word (words revealed or fulfilled) the "heart joy" they experience cannot be taken from them.

Spiritual leaders are to instruct (pass on to) those IN CHRIST rich with many resources to get involved in doing many good works - generously, willingly partnering - with trust focused on God who provided them many resources to be shared and enjoyed.
Having a personal encounter with Jesus should SO FILL the heart with joy for that Christ-follower.

What the temple in Jerusalem was to those under the Abrahamic covenant, so the heart - inner man, soul and more specifically the spirit - is to those under the new covenant of the body and blood of Jesus Christ: (1) 12:5, the place God makes His name to dwell, a holy place and meeting place, John 4:23, 14:23; Ephesians 1:13-14, (2) 12:11, the place God makes His name abide, where the character of Christ is formed and reflected, Galatians 4:19, 5:22-23, (3) 12:18, the place we receive, recognize, and rejoice over all God has given us, a depository of spiritual and heavenly communiques, 2 Peter 1:1-5, (4) 12:21, the place to exercise gratitude in enjoying and expressing all God has provided, gratitude 1 Thessalonians 5:18, (glory) 1 Corinthians 10:31, humility James 4:6, within the boundary of His Word Colossians 3:16; 2 Timothy 3:16-17, Psalm 119:9-16, (5) 12:26, the place reserved for holiness (clean) and offerings (service of self and giftings) to the LORD from a motive of love toward God, Mark 12:28-30; Romans 12:1; Acts 13:22 (example).
There is a joy Jesus experienced which can be experienced to the full by those IN CHRIST.
When oppressed and emotionally beaten down, a Christ-follower should press into the presence of the LORD - for here he finds light, truth, and joy.
Real, life-impacting joy and peace are by-products of trusting God - of walking by faith in God.
No matter where a follower of Christ finds himself, let him never forget the joys of being in the Kingdom of God.
When you are enjoying the fulfilled promises of God and His gracious provision, be alert (pay attention) to continue to love God.
Christ-followers who are affectionately devoted to the things of THIS WORLD make themselves an enemy (opposition to) of God.
God designed the heart of man for one primary love or devotion - LOVE GOD WITH ALL YOUR HEART - any devotion or affection otherwise crowds out God.
God calls out to His disobedient children and urges them to repent, turn away from their other god-like affections - and give Him wholehearted devotion.
The Holy Spirit residing in every Christ-follower yearns (cries out) for our affection.
Those who lead, equip, and buildup others in Christ, should have hearts of love and affection (expressed) for those they influence.
Those who have affectionate friendship with the world are being enmity with God.
Spiritual leaders and those they lead should not withhold affection from one another.
Got so want to people's affection and devotion, He will send a messenger to remind the rebellious people who He is and what He wants.
A wise steward of the gift of God's love in Christ will (1) turn from affections for this world and worldliness around us and (2) turn to obeying God's will out of love for the Father.
An affectionate, loving heart toward the LORD may well result in a costly, but willing offering toward the LORD and His will.
Those on the same ministry team would do well to express affection for one another - brotherly love.
A Christ-following husband and wife are to be affectionate toward one another so as to preclude Satan’s attempts toward sexual immorality or self-satisfaction.
Christ-followers are to adorn the inner man with that which is precious in God's eyes - submissive spirit, gentleness, compassion, love, mercy, courteousness, doing good, and seeking peace.
As Jesus was filled with compassion as the Father for the broken and needy, so Christ-followers should be filled with compassion for the broken and needy.

Though Jesus was 'on mission' in the best sense of the word, He allowed Himself to be interrupted by God's compassion resident in Him to heal people and raise the dead along life's way - without making a show of it.
Mercy and compassion from God's people for the poor, widows, and orphans is a genuine reflection of the heart of God for those people.

The LORD and those in the LORD are moved with compassion for the unsaved - especially in locations wherein He has poured out repeated efforts to reach the lost with His Word, His prophets, and His Spirit.
God sends words of rebuke through His prophets (spokespeople) to His people when they turn from Him AS A MEANS OF SHOWING COMPASSION TOWARD HIS PEOPLE.
God's people should always be reminded God is merciful - compassions come new from Him each day.
This man, Jesus, had a heart of compassion for the broken.
Jesus chose with God's guidance a man needing and wanting healing for 38 years - see the compassion of Jesus and the intimacy of Jesus with the Father.

Christ-followers are to be compassionate to one another - love as brothers, tenderhearted, courteous, returning blessing for evil - because God pays attention to the righteous, those who obey Him by faith.
God is full of compassion, gracious, longsuffering, and abundant in mercy and truth.
From the place of communion with the Father comes compassion for the masses with real needs - one great need being a personal relationship with God.
A great leader can also be a man with compassion and a tender heart.
God's people are to live distinct lives (holy) from the unsaved around them - identifying them as God's people - obedient, loving, compassionate, forgiving, powerful, sacrificing....
God shows His compassion to His people who call upon Him in their need - even at times doing so in a miraculous way.
Compassion for those without Christ should move Spirit-filled Christ followers to teach the people the Word of God - the Word is food for the hungry soul.
Those who walk with God are filled with the compassion of God for His people.
Those who have a real love relationship with God have God's heart of compassion for others.
Jesus ministered the Gospel with compassion and power in healing sicknesses and raising the dead.
When a father who is God's child has a wayward adult child, the father still has compassion for his son and will weep at his death.

Those in Christ are to be of one mind (be about Christ), express compassion to one another, love each other, be tenderhearted, be courteous, not returning evil for evil - this is the calling of following Christ.
Though God may allow periods of great distress and affliction, His mercy and compassion will come to us again - hope in this.
All Christ-followers are to be of one mind - be compassionate to one another, love as brothers, be tenderhearted, be courteous, and bless those who revile them.
Those who follow Jesus extend compassion on those in need.
Jesus expressed compassion to the humble, needy, faith-oriented people.
Jesus had compassion on people drifting purposelessly through life.
Jesus' compassion moved Him to action to meet the needs of others who long attended His teachings.
Jesus demonstrated compassion for people as preempting routine religious rituals.
Those who approach Jesus broken, humble, and in faith find Jesus is compassionate.
Jesus expressed compassion for those who hungered for His teaching and suffered physical hunger in doing so.
Jesus' words have compassion and power to impact those on whom His compassion is directed.
God's kind of love and compassion expresses itself in meeting the needs of others.
Those who relate to God by religious duty will be absent of godly compassion or mercy.
The compassion of God in Christ leads to setting free those bound in sin.
Compassion makes a Christ-like minister.
Those in need may appeal to Jesus on the basis of His mercy and compassion.
Those who believe God and have compassion on the needy will see God work.
Spiritual Leaders are moved with compassion over the real needs of those they lead.
Compassion moves a Christ-follower to do what he can.
Spiritual leaders demonstrate compassion for others in front of their disciples.
A compassionate heart is a good quality to have as a leader.
An appeal to return to God may include: (1) affirmation, (2) invitation, (3) repent, (4) break past patterns, (5) worthy outcome, (6) compassion, and (7) holy desire.
God has compassion on me.
I am to have compassion on those in need.
When one needs compassion and comfort, he or she should draw near to God.
Praise God who is the Father of compassion and the God of all comfort.
Spiritual leaders must be able to minister freely - genuinely, honestly, forthrightly - and to minister with open hearts - expressing real compassion and love.
God is compassionate and merciful toward sinners.
God is compassionate, slow to anger, abounding in love, and relents from sending calamity when people turn to Him.
God deeply desires His people repent and return to Him for He is gracious and compassionate.
Christ-followers can be patient in the face of suffering because the LORD is full of compassion and mercy.
God has mercy and compassion on those who call out to Him.
There is compassion with the LORD.
God deliberately chooses to have mercy or compassion on whoever He chooses.
Those who walk in the footprints of Jesus have compassion on the family members of those who serve Him.
Those in the body of Christ are to be compassionate and merciful toward those who 'wrong' (offend) them.

Christ-followers are - by the Holy Spirit - to be kind (helpful or useful) to one another, tenderhearted (compassionate or understanding), forgiving the wrongs or offenses of one another - even as God in Christ forgave each one of them.
At times, the LORD reveals Himself to unsuspecting persons to express to them compassion and to reveal something more of Himself to man - God Who Sees.
