Those with God’s compassion in their heart extend themselves and sacrifice themselves to meet the needs of another.
The redeemed IN CHRIST must remember to be merciful and compassionate to those still in bondage for they too were once in bondage.
God\'s people are to be compassionate toward those who are hungry - especially orphans and widows.
A mighty man of strength, stamina, and character can also have compassion on those “shamed” by others.
The real lasting and meaningful inheritance to those in Christ is the LORD Himself and the graces that flow out of the relationship with Him - not earthly accumulations.
As sure as eating a honeycomb is sweet on the tongue, so is the knowledge of God's wisdom by a Christ-follower to his soul - along with a real, meaningful future.
Life is from God and is only meaningful when lived in a real and sincere relationship (of trusting God and obeying God) with Him who grants life beyond the grave.
God's beautiful, precious favor (grace) comes to His faithful (obedient by faith) at the most meaningful times and by some most unusual or unexpected means.
One of the greatest and most meaningful encouragements from the LORD to His people is His promised presence "I will be with you."

The prayer life of Christ-followers should be primarily a private prayer life (not avoiding public prayer, but not pursuing it for show) and should be filled with meaningful, heartfelt simple communication with their Father.
There awaits those in Christ a wonderful and meaningful personal relationship with the Father - one in which 'delight of the Father' is the daily experience.
Experiencing trials and suffering in serving the LORD seasons ones life - makes one's life tasty, meaningful.
Jesus spoke with colorful and meaningful symbolism.
Offering to God what was costly makes the offering valuable and meaningful.
Meaningful life is a benefit of living God's wisdom.
Among the needy and rejected of those who are very open to experiencing a meaningful encounter with Jesus Christ as well as those filled with Him).
Being highly involved in (rich in) good works builds a good foundation for that which is life indeed - real life, meaningful life.

How meaningful and beneficial for a senior spiritual leader to write an instructional letter to a young, up and coming spiritual leader - meaningful as the senior includes the both of them as recipients of the same salvation, grace, and peace from the LORD above and beneficial as the senior is passing on to the younger a Spirit-taught collection instructing him how the assemblies of believers are to carry on in Christ.
Jesus Christ (1) abolished death - to render in operative, make of no effect, (2) brought life - full and meaningful, and (3) brought immortality to light (ALL) through the Gospel.
By the purpose and favor of God toward a chosen, faithful follower, God can make his or her life fruitful and meaningful in a land of affliction - even an idolatrous culture.
Husbands and wives need to speak uplifting and attractively to one another.
God is so much more concerned for the hearts and lives of His people toward Him than their politics, comfort, or surroundings.
God is not limited by geography, location, or politics as to how He will grace and bless those He chooses for His own purposes.
God chooses people for certain tasks (one's He knows will fit the task) a Roman citizen could move about the Gentile world of the Romans easily and be protected by the government.
A secular government with moral laws and legal system doesn't mind (or find illegal) its citizens speaking about spiritual (in God and heavenly realm) matters.
Christ-followers are to obey and cooperate with civil governments which are in place by God's design (for civil order).
Oppressive governments with unreasonable, heavy taxation stir contention / division amidst their people.
God has always intended for governments to rule in righteousness.
God can use the administration of a  civil government to accomplish His 'long before' determined and expressed laws.
A man of  God can speak God's Word truthfully to a national government official and speak to the ruler with respect.
Christ-followers are to pay what they owe to the government(s) over them and pay what they owe (in obedience) to the LORD to Whom they belong.
God removes political or governmental leaders and raises up political or governmental leaders as He wills.
There are times God grants to His servants a huge boldness in obeying Him - even boldness to stand in front of government officials and declare them sinners before God, right to their face.
Give to others what is due them from you (friends, family, government, whatever), and also give to God what is due Him.

Christ-followers are to give to society and government that which belongs to them and to God that which belongs to Him - the later being our wholehearted allegiance (supreme devotion) in obedience by faith.
Submission with integrity to those in authority over you (employer, government) by God's people makes a strong impression on those in authority.
Followers of Christ are to live virtuous lives before all - even submitting to every ordinance of man - kings, governors, and governments - for the LORD's sake.
Governments are ordained by God to punish evil doers and for the praise of those who do good.
Disciples of Jesus should give government and society their due, while giving God what is due Him - to the former, a portion and to the later, their ALL.
God works His will even through secular governments and immoral religious people.

Christ-followers need reminded to submit to governmental authorities, submit to advice and counsel, be ready to do whatever God directs them to do, avoid vilifying others, be peaceful, gentle, and humble toward all.
It is a blessing to the people when government and religious leaders agreed to promote God's Word.
Christ-followers should recognize and respond to governments according to the laws.
God can cause unregenerate government leaders to recognize the social and moral value of living according to His Word.
There are times when God's messenger - God's people - will have to take a public stand against a governmental official.
Spiritual leaders are to encourage those they lead to pray for all those in governmental authority.
Prayers for governmental authorities should consist of requests, petitions, intercessions, and thanksgiving.
Prayers for governmental authorities is so that Christ-followers may live peaceful and quiet lives in all godliness and holiness.
Sometimes governmental authorities persecute the body of Christ.
Got may provide opportunities to witness to high ranking government officials.
God can use social strife and government interaction to get a teacher of the God's Truth brought into a situation.
Even high governmental employees need instructed in the ways of the LORD.
Ministers of God can have influence on high government employees.
Those who follow Christ are to give their civil government what is due by the law.
There are likely some in high government and influential positions who seek after or follow after Jesus unbeknown to most.
There is a stewardship of citizenship or government that Christ-followers are to honor - taxes, customs, respect, and honor of laws.
It is simple and congruent for the LORD God to work in such ways as to astonish idol worshippers - even highly educated, governmental leaders.
Those in Christ who are led or forced to live in the midst of an idolatrous culture are free to serve the peoples - even in the government - but not serve and worship idols and false gods.

Those Christ-followers God is using among an idolatrous culture - even serving the government - may be promoted to very high ranking positions due to the wisdom, character, and revelation(s) given them by God.
The Holy Spirit brings Christ-followers to Scripture verses and reveals to them what God is saying - relevant truths.
Here is the challenge to elders of churches to rule (govern), to bishop (oversee), and to shepherd the people of God.
Disciple makers (apostles and others) know to appoint elders (plural) among groups of new believers (Christ-followers) to oversee the fellowship according to God's design.
As God spoke from heaven in the past, many Muslim's coming to Christ today report God giving them vivid dreams wherein He or Jesus speaks to them - even quoting verses from the Bible.
One person is not of more value than another, it's just that one is appointed to function as a leader - making decisions, overseeing, and giving direction.
The role of an elder is one of shepherding the Christ-followers around them - serving as an overseer and an example to others.
Elders, who serve as overseers faithfully, will receive a crown of glory at the LORD's coming.
God will personally oversee the destruction of Babylon.

Once the Gospel has been preached in an area and Christ-followers have come forth, apostolic-type servants should (1) appoint elders as overseers and (2) set in order the operation of the assembly according to God's Word.

Those who would serve as a leader or overseer in the body of Christ must meet the qualifications brought forward in God's Word; (1) blameless, (2) husband of one wife, (3) temperate, (4) sober-minded, (5) good behavior, (6) hospitable, (7) able to teach, (8) not given to wine, (9) not violent, (10) not greedy for money, (11) gentle, (12) not quarrelsome, (13) not covetous, (14) one who rules his own house well, not a novice, and (15) a good testimony in the community at large.
The church, assembly, body of Christ is to be ordered as God has put forth in the Word with qualified overseers and deacons serving under the Holy Spirit and gifted servants full of the Holy Spirit.
Christ-followers are to serve the LORD without complaining or disputing that they may shine as lights in a crooked and perverse world.
Those who have God's wisdom hate pride, arrogance, the evil way, and the perverse mouth.
Remember (even as stated in verse 7 above) God is a God of mercy - and certainly mercy precedes keeping of external religious rules.
God can and will see to it that the smallest of details He has determined will come to pass in doing His will - details so diverse HE ONLY could accomplish them.

This very day the churches in America and in so many other parts of the world need to heed this verse to WAKE UP TO RIGHTEOUSNESS (obey God by faith) and avoid living sinfully in this life, because failing to live in righteousness and avoid sinful living harms our witness to those yet unsaved.
God initiates conversation with those He chooses to converse with for His purposes.
God can in one day reverse a situation (from an otherwise disastrous outcome) to a glorious, God-honoring day to remember.
Those in the body of Christ are to love greatly those overseers laboring among them for the sake of their works.
Those elders who serve God faithfully and willingly - shepherding God's flock as examples and overseers - will receive a crown of glory at Christ's return.
The redeemed WERE like sheep without a shepherd, but in Christ have a Shepherd and Overseer.
Elders are given to the church to oversee - rule or govern - and to equip for ministry.
Disciples of Jesus should be blameless, harmless, and without fault in the middle of a crooked and perverse generation - such disciples shine as lights.
God assigns called out ones to oversee and others to serve the body of Christ.
A worthless and wicked man is characterized by the following: perverse mouth, flattery, directionless, contemplates evil continually, and sows dischord.
Those who walk with God know what the perverse are up to.
Some decisions in response to God's direction or leadership cannot be reversed after the fact.
Large groups of people require a multiplicity of leaders and overseers.
A bishop or overseer should not be a novice.
God can meet the needs - provide for - of His obedient servants in many diverse ways.
A bishop or overseer is to be of solid Christ-like character, of healthy relationships in his family, and of good reputation in the community.
Those who are to serve as deacons must meet basically the same criteria as overseers with the exception of being apt to teach.
A Christ-follower may pursue the office of overseer.
A bishop or overseer should be apt to teach and not in love with money.
A bishop or overseer should be the loving, respected leader of his family.
By faith Christ-followers understand the universe was formed at God's command.
When God formed the universe, He made what is seen out of what was invisible.
Spiritual leaders are accountable to God as to how they oversee a group of Christ-followers.
It is no advantage to a group of Christ-followers to reject or rebel against their overseers' watchcare.
Better is a poor man whose walk is blameless than a rich man whose ways are perverse.
Spiritual leaders have the responsibility assigned by the Holy Spirit of being overseers of those in the flock.
Those who are involved in same sex partnerships are behaving in a perverse way according to God.
God is unique, great, King, true, living, everlasting, Creator, wisdom, speaking, sustains the universe, LORD of host while idols are none of this.
Those who continue faithfully to work with and invest the LORD's endowments will be rewarded by receiving more endowments to manage or oversee for the LORD.
A stewards is one given the responsibility to oversee - manage, operate, utilize, maximize - assets which belong to another to whom the steward is accountable.
Stewards don't necessarily do the work to accomplish a task, but oversee it by selecting and assigning others the actual work.
A steward who oversees the assets of this master (employer, owner) well will be given more assets to oversee.
Simply saying, 'I love you' to a Christ-follower in need is a failure of stewardship - which failure must be reversed by actual deeds involving giving financial or material assistance.

Spiritual leaders are under an injunction to (1) repeatedly speak about what fits with or matches with those (verses 11-14) things, to (2) exhort, personally instruct or address, and to (3) rebuke - convince with solid compelling evidence, expose - and do so (all three of these points) with every form of authority (all the leverage) possible not letting anyone look down on them (especially of a younger spiritual leader).

For an elder to be selected as an overseer - a trust given by God to manage - he must further qualify (beyond as an elder) (1) selfless, (2) patient, (3) drinks little or no wine, (4) non-violent, (5) doesn't chase money, (6) loves people, (7) prudent, (8) just, (9) holy, (10) self-controlled, (11) holds firmly to God's truth (knows it and applies it), and (12) able through teaching God's Word to exhort (personally instruct) and expose false teaching.
If a man IN CHDRIST aspires to (inclines) serve the body of Christ as an overseer (bishop), he desires or yearns for a good work - irrefutably so.

Because God desires men to be saved, because God gave a Mediator (Jesus Christ), because the ransom has been paid for all, and because assigned ones are proclaiming the Gospel of Christ, spiritual leaders resolutely intend for men IN CHRIST to continue in prayer (two-way converse with God) in every place they go and gather - praying backed up by  holy or set-apart life (without any anger or doubt toward God).
The elders who serve a local assembly as an overseer (episkopos) need to be qualified before selected.

Necessary qualifications to be a bishop or overseer include (1) above reproach (no accusations that stick), (2) a one-wife husband, (3) abstain from all or immoderate use of wine, (4) sober or sound mind (prudent), (5) well behaved, (6) apt to and skillful in teaching, (7) avoids sitting long at wine, (8) not violent, (9) not loving money (greedy), (10) not covetous, (11) governs his household well (including respect from children), (12) not a novice IN CHRIST (a novice as bishop elicits pride and all that goes with pride), and (13) a good testimony or reputation among those outside the body of Christ.

A spiritual leader in a time-period of general apostacy MUST (imperative, injunction) (1) draw empowerment out of the grace of God (verse 1), (2) commit God's Word and teachings to proven men capable of teaching others (verse 2), (3) endure troubles and hardships (verses 3-6), (4) ponder your instructions that God give you a fuller understanding of them (verse 7), (5) remember (time and again) the Gospel of Jesus Christ and the whole of God's Word is not chained (restrained) (verses 8-9), (6) remind the faithful men who will teach others - God is faithful and will keep His Word (verse 14), (7) exert energy to rightly deliver God's Word of truth (verse 15), (8) avoid vain conversations (verses 16-18), (9) depart, flee from sin and immature desires (verses 19-22), and (10) avoid arguments and disputes while focusing on patiently and humbly teaching God's truth.

Those who would be men of faith - taking God at His Word for salvation and all that is in it - are those who (1) receive God\'s promises, verse 15, (2) remember God\'s promises, verses 3-4, (3) experience God\'s promises, verses 11-14, (4) pass on God\'s promises, verses 15-16, and (5) cling to God\'s promises, verses 19-22.
Jesus Christ of Nazareth and His role as Spokesman for God (Prophet) are foretold in these verses.

God is (1) to be feared and respected v.10, (2) invisible but speaks, sees, hears, eats, smells vv. 12-15, 28, (3) Owner of the universe v.19, (4) Sovereign Gatherer of His own people v.20, (5) a consuming fire v.24, (6) a jealous God v.24, (7) findable vv.29-31, (8) merciful v.31, (9) covenant keeping v.31, (10) revealer of Himself vv.32-33, (11) like no other - none besides Him vv.35-36, (12) Present and mighty in power on behalf of His people v.37, (13) Savior to deliver His people into His promised inheritance v.37, (14)  Doer of the impossible vv.37-38, (15) God alone in heaven and on earth.
To deal with a multi-cultural conflict before it gets out of hand - informed, Spirit-led leaders should implement God's plan; lifting up Scripture and obedience to it.
Some changes or 'moves' are forced on us and work together as part of God's plan.
In God's plan Israel has a fruitful future - what seemed spiritually dead will bud and blossom with true worship of the LORD.
One day Jerusalem will be an abundantly flourishing city with multitudes of people - all due to God's plan.
The devil has tried multiple times along the way to destroy the genealogical 'line' in which the Savior of the World, Jesus Christ, would come in order to thwart God's plan.

A leader of God's people - who experience outside interference with doing God's will - needs to point all back to God's expressed will and dismiss the opposers - since they have no part IN GOD'S plans.
God sometimes reveals to and through one of His prophets or Spirit-filled spokespeople a word about how one's life will be used in God's plan.
Disobedience to God comes with a certain price to be paid according to God's plan and purposes.
God's plan may be different than those of a man 'after God's own heart' and greater than those of a man 'after God's own heart.'

The cost of becoming a disciple of Jesus consists of (1) deny self (take fully to God's priorities), (2) take up his cross (surrender your entire future), and (3) follow Jesus (keep on following God's plan for your life).
Jesus teaches God's plan and purpose for marriage is that a man be joined with his wife to become one and not to be separated by divorce.
God's plan to bring His Word to men is that they hear the Scriptures - the Bible is God's Word of revelation and hope.
God's plans (future purposes) may be SO MUCH bigger than what we see.
Sometimes the resistance of people toward God and God's activities are actually IN GOD'S PLANS to achieve His full purposes.
There are those who want to subvert God's plans, taking matters into their own hands, except for God's intervention.
God's plans include the redemption of (what else but what we call) foreigners.
Those who have communion with God (receiving his Word and will) can speak up in faith as they see God's plan unfolding.
God's plan includes people of many nations coming by faith into His family.
A fruitless branch (follower of Jesus) is not God's plan or purpose.
Spiritual growth or maturity is God's plan for followers of Jesus SO THAT they will be firm in their beliefs - not subject to every wind of teaching or trickery of men full of deceit.
God's plan is that the fruit of His disciples last.

Those who best serve others first see themselves as bondservants of the LORD, recognize they are selected and assigned by God, acknowledge God's Word as the basis of ministry - backed with a godly life, and clearly hopeful regarding God's planned future.
God's plan to guard the heart and mind of His disciples from anxiety and worry is PRAYER.
God's plan is unfolding step by step.
The LORD is committed to reaching those that are His - in God's planned redemption.
God's plan and purpose in Jesus Christ reveal that grace, not works, is the means by which God will work.
God's plan - though rejected by some - is marvelous in the eyes of those who walk IN His plans.
The enemy may use confusion to frustrate God's people as they carry out God's plan.
Preaching God's message in God's time will have God's planned results.
Peace is present in those who know God's plan is unfolding.
Spiritual leaders with a lack of faith in God will fail to see God's plan and work come to fruition.
topics: Lack faith, God's plan, fail, see, fruition

results.text: Those walking in God's planned purposes need NOT worry or be afraid.
Part of God's plan may include the introduction of an obstacle.
God's plan of salvation through Jesus Christ was at work before time began.
In time, God's orchestrated events are seen as well-timed in the working out of God's plan and purpose.
Multiple wives is not God's plan for His people.
It was God's plan in eternity past to extend His saving grace.
God's plan involves people obeying Him in relationship to others obeying Him.
Believer should see their assignment as their responsibility in God's plan.
God's people can be organized and what they do in carrying out God's plan.
Disobedience and rebellion by God's people can cost them their future role(s) in God's plan.
Those who have walked intimately with God know God and God's plan more precisely than others.
Jesus took common elements from life and illustrated intimately what is God's plan of salvation.
Satan tries time and again to interfere with (1) God's plans and (2) those obeying God's will.
God's plan to save by grace through Jesus Christ was made visible in the life, death, resurrection, and ascension of Jesus Christ.
Some Christ-followers don't want (due to ethnic prejudices) others among certain people groups to receive God's Gospel of grace through Jesus - and will angrily react against it.
God chose some to serve him who previous to His grace were fighting against Him - inflicting persecution on those believing in Jesus Christ.
God grants the grace miracle of healing others to various ones to achieve His purposes.
Some families in Christ are greatly graced by God to have multiple one's in public service to the LORD.
God grants grace to the humble, faithful servant - even using civil society and appointed leaders when He chooses.
The LORD may come personally to some He is granting grace and faith for salvation as well as His purposes.
The extending of mercy and grace by the LORD does not preclude or exclude the sincere word - 'from now onward, sin no more.'
Many times those who see (by God's grace) the hope (truth promised) are accused (and maybe slandered) by those looking for (but not in God's grace) the hope (truth promised) but BLIND to it as yet.
Receiving God's grace does not ignore the need to repent of sins and walk in righteousness.
What boldness (how assuring) one can have recognizing (by God's grace) your assigned 'life message' aligns rightly with the Scriptures - Law, Prophets, Psalms.
Some offerings to the LORD are by commitment (based on vows) while other offering are freewill or grace offerings to the LORD and His work.

Some who formerly in unbelief fought against Christ and the body of Christ later come by God's grace in Christ to fight for Christ and the body of Christ - even formerly murdering Christ-followers; later a co-laborer in Life-giving redemption.
God has always desired and sought two things from those who relate to Him - (1) love Him and (2) obey Him - to whom He grants mercy and grace.
A Christ-follower is to TRUST GOD as he uses and invest the God-given abilities, gifts, and grace from the LORD.
The opportunity to serve the LORD - receive an assignment from Him - is a grace gift of God.
God's grace leads to humble obedience, to God's grace in nearness, and to exaltation in grace.
Those who have turned from God and come under His judgment will one day (by His mercy and grace) turn to God and plead for restoration.
God gives grace (so abundant at times) to His people who, in brokenness, humble themselves in trust toward Him.
A recipient of huge amounts of God's grace may (at a familiar temptation) (1) choose to sin and (2) attempt to cover it - both of which displease the LORD.
To rebuke or oppose a brother in sin - do so to his face (personally, face to face) with the Word of God and in the grace of God.
Acting presumptuously toward God's grace as a license to sin is a terrible mindset with costly consequences.
By faith in God, the following are the possession of each Christ-follower - (1) grace abounding, (2) gift, (3) righteousness, (4) Jesus Christ, (5) free gift, and (6) justification.
Your spiritual gift(s), faith, and function are all grace gifts from God for use and benefit of Christ's body.
These who would be on the front lines of the LORD's work must be those who have learned (by the Spirit and grace) to hear the LORD.
God extends mercy and grace to those who hear His Word with a tender heart humble themselves, weep, and seek His face.

The CHRIST-LIFE (Christ in you) is reflected by experiencing the LORD (1) as my Shepherd, (2) lack of want, (3) inner rest, (4) leading me to walk in obedience, (5) don't fear evil, (6) have God's presence, (7) peace in health / trusts, (8) meeting my needs, (9) the Spirit giving me knowledge, (10) abundant life, (11) mercy and grace daily, and (12) looking to rewards in His presence one day.
Those who by God's grace wholly follow the LORD God are (1) few in number, (2) know God's strength, (3) prosper in doing God's will, and (4) see God work.
The body of Christ should be unified on the Gospel - it is of Christ, on Christ, and His power released in a grace gift to all who believe.
When under spiritual attack, humble oneself, seek God's face, and call on those who are spiritually attune to pray with you for God's mercy and grace.
God shows mercy and grace to those who He knows humble themselves toward Him.
The real lasting and meaningful inheritance to those in Christ is the LORD Himself and the graces that flow out of the relationship with Him - not earthly accumulations.
God gives grace to the humble.
What a grace testimony at the end of life-long ministry to finish all the way with integrity.
One who takes lightly God's grace upon grace by disobeying the LORD again may find a high price is to be paid.
God can give a nation / a people a rest (of grace) in which they should 'seek the LORD' all the more.
Chastening, suffering, and tears, are for a short time, whereas God's abundant grace is from now onward.
Sometimes God's will to possessing His grace-given possession includes doing a survey.
A servant of God must, by God's grace and Spirit, seek God and hear God - doing what He says; then, see God work.
One becomes 'great' in a kingdom sense because God is 'with him' - dispensing great grace.
Those in the grace of God should thank and praise Him morning and evening.
Those who respond to God's 'chastening' events with humility, repentance, and works of repentance / restoration will find God's grace.
The number, frequency, and magnitude of the grace(s) (favor upon favor) God has given me are too many to number and add up to too much to measure.
God changes the way(s) He meets the basic needs of His people from time to time - one miracle way to another; grace to grace.
A Christ-follower whose heart is 'AFTER GOD'S HEART' might well pray (1) for God's guidance through the Word and (2) for God's grace to avoid dominion by any sin.

Those, in the LORD, who respond humbly (seek the LORD) following a rebuke from the LORD will find grace to enable them to minister / to be used to spiritually help others - encouraging them to obey God's Word in fear / trust of God.

Spiritual leaders (pastors, teachers) are to take with strength through grace God's Word taught (revealed) to them and DEPOSIT it in faithful men so they faithful (to the deposit) will TEACH OTHERS what God says / taught them.
God's 'promised rest' (eternal salvation in God's family) is entered by faith in His powerful, living Word (not by endeavors / works) and experienced with help from Him who grants mercy and grace.
Those who take God at His Word concerning Jesus Christ are justified (declared in right standing) by His grace through the redemption (purchase) that is in Jesus Christ.
God's people should take opportunities to demonstrate the mercy and grace of God - including to the handicapped or challenged.
What an outrageous grace of God to not only speak to and speak through a servant, but to affirm it as His Word.

Those who God has called / assigned to minister His Word should (1) receive His grace humbly, (2) prepare their heart to seek to know the Word, (3) live the word, (4) teach the Word, and (5) become skilled (an expert) by God's grace in the Word.
All Christ-followers are to be submissive to one another (clothed with humility) because God gives more grace to the humble.
Those who radically follow Christ - carrying and teaching God's Word to new areas - will (1) appear as foolish, (2) will suffer, (3) and by God's grace labor SO all the more.
The grace of God that saves a Christ-follower also prompts him / her to be zealous for good works.
Those who trust in the LORD will find His mercy and grace will keep them.
God can SO GRACE His people (even delivering from annihilation) filling them with light, joy, gladness, and honor as to produce an evangelistic outbreak - many coming to faith in the LORD.
God gives grace to some genealogical lines - more in one line than another - to do what is right in His eyes.
Oh, the grace of intimacy God grants to some of His!
Individuals are saved by the mercy and grace of God - not because of his or her own will or efforts.
In times of suffering and distress, Christ-followers would do well to remember to turn (wholeheartedly) to God, for it is God in His mercy and grace, His might and power who delivers.
Except for the mercy and grace of God, those who live in sin (disobedience or rebellion) against God feel or sense God is hidden from them.
REAL revival or restoration of a group or nation 'in name God-honoring people' can come to pass by an act of God's mercy and grace - pleaded for by a remnant.
Is it so difficult for one IN THE SPIRIT to discern or receive or know the thoughts or reactions (to God's mercy and grace at work) in the unregenerate religious peoples?
Man's days on earth are so brief - one should seek to live according to God's grace and wisdom.
Christ-followers trust God to bless and grace them in order that others will come to know Him and praise Him, too.
You cannot understand the words and works of God apart from a work of grace by God in your heart and mind.
God's beautiful, precious favor (grace) comes to His faithful (obedient by faith) at the most meaningful times and by some most unusual or unexpected means.
One of the greatest acts of God's grace towards those IN CHRIST is to open the Scriptures or grant comprehension of the Scriptures!
Those cut off from God are spiritually dead - who by God's grace He imparts life by His Spirit and raises them to new life.
Those who are granted to recognize they are recipients of God's grace and power may well respond with fear and awe toward God as well as humility in their heart.
Those involved in grace and Spirit-filled ministry need often to withdraw to private communion with the Father.
The FREE GRACE GIFT of righteousness came through One, Jesus Christ.
God sovereignly brings mercy and grace to those He has chosen to use or work through.
To be indwelt by God's Spirit - being IN CHRIST - is the greatest grace known on this earth.
Those convicted of sin should (1) return to the LORD, (2) acknowledge specifically their sin, (3) fall on God's mercy and grace, and (4) trust God to save them.
If and when any recognize God releasing a judgment they should wholeheartedly fall with brokenness on God's mercy and grace.
Every Gentiles IN CHRIST should praise God for His election of grace to the nations.
God's grace plus God-honoring heart commitment can serve a Christ-follower well.
Those who sin greatly - having received grace and light - bring on themselves a potent, righteous response from God.
When God sends the Holy Spirit of grace on a people, they recognize Jesus for who He is.
God grants more of Himself and His 'heavenly gifts' - light, wisdom, grace, productivity, Word - to those who receive and implement what He gave them already.
Those in Christ who would go after God's heart (1) exercise a surrendered heart (revive me in Your way) and (2) ask for grace to turn away from focusing on worthless things.
Those in Christ by grace through faith are free to follow the Holy Spirit and should NOT fall back under (bondage to) any external religious requirements.
If one is Christ tries afterward to earn justification by keeping one or more external religious requirements, they essentially have fallen from grace back into law.

Those who name the name of Christ, but act in terribly unbecoming and sinful ways among fellow Christ-followers, are a disgrace to the name of Christ and - if they continue in the same - will be among those who will spend eternity separated from God.
Grace gospel proclaimers must keep their message and life free from confusion - NOT mixing 'works of the law' - any external religious requirements - into or onto the grace gospel message.
The 'work' Jesus came to do by God's grace is completed and He sits now at God's right hand in authority over heaven and earth.
There are some ill-informed or false teachers who proclaim a gospel - which is NOT a gospel - other than the gospel of grace in Christ.
Grace and peace come from the Father through our Lord Jesus Christ.
Any teacher or preacher who tries to twist or pervert the grace gospel of Christ is accursed or should be accursed.
Twisting or perverting the grace gospel of Christ is a great offense in the eyes of God.
Some try to get Christ-followers to add external religious requirements to the grace gospel of Jesus Christ.
Those in Christ are dead to the law and alive in the grace gospel of Christ.

When an unsaved person is granted the grace to see that a relationship with God is superior to all external religious obligations and rituals, that unsaved person is close to being saved - entering God's kingdom.
Turning away from the grace gospel in Jesus Christ to another gospel - of which there is none - is a foolish mistake of poorly grounded, novice believers.
Those in the grace of Jesus Christ need not fall back into religious bondage of some external religious requirements considered to be essential to salvation.
Disciple makers sometimes find it necessary to rebuke those they are raising up as disciples to move them by God's grace to focus on God and what God is saying in situations.
Those who by God's grace receive and apply the things God reveals to them of Himself and from His Word - the more will be given them from Him.
God, in His grace, affirms the obedience by faith of His children, including that obedience of Jesus Christ - sometimes even with verbal words of affirmation.
All people saved are saved the same way, by God's grace through faith in Jesus Christ.
In spite of opposition and persecution, Spirit-filled Christ-followers - being obedient in proclaiming life in Christ - may well see God's grace poured out to those who will believe on Christ.

God has His eye out for key men and women He wishes to pour mercy and grace upon AND He sends to them a faithful witness with His Scripture to bring them into His forever family and SPREAD the Gospel to other nations.
Even in a generally dark day among God's people, He may send grace with a revival among the obedient-by-faith-remnant.
Who says the Old Testament fails to speak of God's mercy and grace, kindness and patience?
The God-oriented understand that God has not treated us with judgment to the degree we all deserve, but has extended mercy and grace to us.
The leaders of God's people are also to be givers - formerly tithers, now grace givers of all that God provides them.
Humility and repentance in a sinner finds mercy and grace from the Father.
One day God will pour grace on Israel and they will see that Jesus is the Christ whom they rejected - and they will mourn like never before.
Christ-followers are to be filled with and share with those in need God's mercy and grace - love your neighbor.
What grace of God is experienced as the obedient and faithful of God walk with 'the hand of the LORD upon them.'
By the grace of God, the people of God come to obey His voice through the voice of His prophets.
What spectacular grace God granted these two disciples - to open their eyes to see the resurrected Jesus!

Those in relationship with God as Father look to Him to supply or provide their daily needs - not that they avoid productive work, but trust God to grace the work of their hands in meeting their daily needs.
Oh, how great is the grace or favor of the LORD upon one who is in relationship with the Father.
When by God's grace He shows you truth (reveals the Word to you), receive it and put it to use - you will receive more Word from Him.
Some, by God's grace, are more sure of God and His Word than they are that the sun will rise in the morning.
Is the authority to forgive sins also granted to Christ-followers who are granted the grace to bring healing to the sick?
Those in Christ who know and recognize God's grace in their life - excelling in whatever they do for God's glory - may be raised up to new and higher opportunities of service.
Remember, God gives grace to the humble.
It behooves all to discover by God's grace how to have one's name maintained in the Book of Life and do so now.
God gave bring His grace (favor) to bear any place or way He chooses to accomplish His purposes.
Those who by God's grace are waiting - seeking, searching, watching, looking, hoping - on God and His Word to come to pass will not be disappointed.
God grants grace to those He chooses, even those who might be found displaced previously by His own judgment.
God extends a word of mercy and grace for His name's sake toward those who today are in rebellion toward Him.
God judges all men in righteousness with mercy and grace according to His Word - His righteousness which supersedes what any man thinks or believes.
We trust the LORD to grant us mercy and grace that through the same others may see Him and know Him.
Those who have found the mercy of God in delivering them from sin and the grace of God in granting them works of His grace should be full of praise and thanksgiving to God.
By the grace of God, those who have been in rebellion for a period of time will awaken and cry out to the LORD for His mercy and intervention in their life.

Christ-followers should bless God for all these graces He gives us: (1) forgives our sins, (2) heals our diseases, (3) delivers us from destruction, (4) showers us with His lovingkindness and tender mercy, (5) satisfies us with good things, and (6) renews our strength.
There are many benefits or graces given us by God for which He deserves to be blessed and blessed some more.
Riches may or may not increase due to God's grace, but no matter what never set your heart on the riches - reserve the heart for God alone.
Christ-followers are to grow in the grace and knowledge of the LORD so they won't be led away from false teachers.
Jesus is the Son of God, full of grace and truth.
The more a Christ-follower knows the LORD the more grace and peace are multiplied to them.
God resists the proud, but gives grace to the humble.
Through God's mercy and grace He can bring a time in which His Word is heard by those who look to Him.
God can send you a different word about your situation - appearing as it were to change His mind - adding grace upon grace from the previous word He sent.
It is by God's grace we in Christ testify of the LORD and of His work(s).

God's mercy and grace flow out since some come to the presence of the LORD out of a burdened heart seeking God in unorthodox ways - not knowing or not understanding - while others are interceding for the revival to spread to more and more people.
Suffering of Christ-followers mixed with God's grace results in maturity - being established, strengthened, and settled.
God's grace is poured out on those who humbly look to and yield to the LORD.
A Christ-following husband is to give honor and respect to His wife - at least because they are both heirs of the grace of life.
The 'hand of God' or grace of God is there as revival breaks out to call people together with singleness of heart to obey the LORD by obeying His Word.
Those who are plundered and treated treacherously look to and call on God for His grace.
Don't get involved in observing obscure teachings - but remain solidly in a grace relationship with God and the body of Christ.

Those in Christ who flagrantly sin against God are invoking God's vengeance by (1) trampling as it were Christ's sacrificial blood under foot and (2) insulting the very Holy Spirit who brought him or her God's grace in the first place.

All in Christ - especially those more mature who recognize by God's grace the immutability of God - possess a very strong assurance (like an anchor) that all God's Word is coming to pass as He has said.

Every Christ-follower has a standing invitation extended by the Holy Spirit to boldly come to the throne of the LORD to obtain mercy and find grace to help in time of need - accept the invitation and come daily.
Those in Christ have experienced God's mercy and grace in Christ - not by works of their righteousness - and have been justified to become heirs of the hope of eternal life.
Those who rise with success with God's grace to grand places may experience the spoil of it all due to the buildup of pride in their heart and thus, fail to 'finish well' in God's eyes or men's eyes.
The grace and mercy of God are part of the revelation of God in the Old Testament.
Every Christ-follower should be experiencing inward peace and rest since receiving from God a bountiful amount of mercy and grace.

Those in Christ must contend for the faith - its truth in its earliest form - because some men will creep in among the family of God to turn God's grace into lewdness and deny (reject as LORD) our LORD and the LORD Jesus Christ.
The very grace of God that saves us also teaches us to deny ungodliness and worldly desires, live soberly, live obediently by faith, and look forward to the blessed hope to come in Jesus Christ.
God reveals to His chosen servants (spokespersons) that which He is going to do - this is God's character of grace revealed.
Every Christ-follower should work as hard as they can to become strong - as strong as God will allow - in the grace (gift) that is theirs through Jesus Christ.
God so wants His chosen ones to obey He extends to them mercy and grace.
God chooses to work through men of simple background and education - men who will obey Him by grace and magnify the name of the LORD.
Manifestations of God's power mixed with mercy and grace can bring foreigners - outsiders, unbelievers - to hold God in awe and respect God's people.
God reaches down in His mercy and grace to bring spiritual restoration to His people who have wandered from Him and He uses leaders whom He has raised up in bringing the revival.
It is the LORD who selects us out of His grace to serve Him and enables (empowers) us to carry out the ministry He assigns - even if He selects us from a wretched, sinful background.
God's servants may at times work miracles - altering the natural - to reveal to God's people God's mercy and grace.
God's grace may fall to a man who is living a terrible testimony before God - falling on this one because of a 'word' God gave another - the grace coming through the promise God made to the other.
God often directs His people to show mercy and grace to foreigners - even to those who create problems - as in Jesus' teaching to love your enemies....
Those in Christ have complete redemption through His blood, which includes forgiveness of sins in an amount equal to the rich richness of His grace.
The ministry or assignment God gives His chosen ones is (1) a gift of His grace and (2) a work accomplished by His power.
God has already blessed those in Christ with every kind of spiritual blessing possible in the spiritual realm to the praise of the glory of His grace.
Those who serve the LORD need to (by God's grace) build up their endurance so they can persevere in days of adversity.
There are very likely more relating to God by His grace through Jesus Christ than we are aware of now.

Through our LORD Jesus Christ we have (1) peace with God, (2) access into grace, (3) rejoice in hope of all that is to come, and (4) give glory to God in the tribulations that walking with Christ bring with it.
Where sin reigned resulting in death (separation from God), grace reigns (through righteousness) now resulting in eternal life - life joined with God.
Justification is a result of the free gift of righteousness which came by faith in the person and work of Jesus Christ - a grace received.
Sin shall not have dominion over me since I am under grace.
It is a testimony to God's grace when those who work with you and for you really enjoy working with you and for you.
Christ-followers are not to continue in sin just because we are under grace and not under law - we are now slaves of righteousness; doing what is right in God's eyes.

Spiritual leaders (spiritual fathers) long to be with those young ones who have come to faith in Christ so they can impart some spiritual gift, grace, or blessing (strength, encouragement, etc.) to them.
Grace and peace (real, inner peace) come from God and the LORD Jesus Christ.
Apostleship is a grace gift through Jesus to those He sends to the nations with the Gospel of Jesus Christ.
The grace gifts of God at work in an obedient servant of His can be observed (in the Spirit) by those who witness the work.
A leader of God's people can show mercy and grace to one who has shown signs of 'leadership rebellion.'
Those who are recipients of God's mercy and grace find it easier to grant the same to others.
Those who receive God's mercy and grace want to be with the LORD - follow Him.

Upon hearing how God had chosen to bless this family (and by faith the word is received), one 'after God's own heart' takes time to go SIT BEFORE GOD to meditate on God's grace, humbling and sovereign grace.
There is man's viewpoint and God's viewpoint - it behooves Christ-followers to obtain by grace God's viewpoint on matters.
Those with a heart for God find themselves willingly confessing their sins - especially as they consider the great saving grace of God.

Mephibosheth is the picture of God's redeeming of a condemned to death person. David takes into his home this grandson of King Saul, saves him, and keeps him all his days (otherwise all other kings would kill the descendants of their predecessors).  This is mercy and grace!

Great would be the blessing from God that He would grant to one of His faithful ones - (1) grace without measure, (2) impact on lives of others, (3) manifest His presence and power, and (4) keep this one from engaging in an evil life.
Faithful Christ-followers can find pleasure (heart-level satisfaction) in enduring crises, burdens, and extended needs because God's applied grace in those situations honors Christ.
Those who do what God says and teach others to do what God says will be acknowledge for such (by God's grace) in heaven.
The grace of God is sufficient to compensate for any handicap or weakness a faithful Christ-follower may possess.
The grace of God is magnified or comes to its greatest impact when applied up against a handicap or weakness.
Obedience to God NOW is so very important - for the grace of God is NOW to empower the obedient one to follow God by faith.
Christ-followers should be careful to acknowledge His grace at work, express gratitude, and walk in His ways (by His Word).
Some assemblies of Christ-followers misunderstand God's grace to mean 'allowance' - allowing outward sins to continue without consequences.

God's grace can be a great motivator for a man of God to excel - not at all leading to a spiritually lazy life, but on the contrary leading to a hard-working, labor-intensive life for Christ energized by none other than God Himself.

How wise for a Christ-follower to realize his or her days are limited in number - thus, they need to make everyday count for the LORD, do today what God has made known to you, relate to God today as warmly as the grace of God will allow.
Many are the faithful works of the LORD toward Christ-followers - the mercy and grace of God are innumerable.
Grateful hearts find ways to express such to God - for all the grace and power and kindness He has shown.
Christ-followers need to realize that the graces God grants (whether tangible or not) are not earned by righteous deeds, but given out of God's sovereign choices and His faithfulness to His Word.
You don't enter God's kingdom through intellect, philosophy, or high-powered reasoning, but through grace with faith in what God has said and done in Jesus Christ.

A godly spiritual leader who has forfeited some future grace of God may still have a heart for the people of God - desiring to see a spiritually sensitive man take the role of leader next - the one God will choose.
God grants through His sovereign grace whose ears will be open to the things of Him.
Those who know the LORD and have been recipients of His grace can testify to the next generation that it is God who has done this work.
By God's grace, be one who believes the work of God - not discounting or disbelieving what God is doing in your day.
Separation and devotion to God is a choice one makes under the grace of God.

Sometimes the people of God and servants of God fall short and do not handle in God's grace the pressures of ministries that come against them - even complaining and whining to the LORD for release from this ministry.
Every reminder through bringing an offering to God is a reminder of our sin and a reminder of God's ample mercy and grace.
God's people, by His grace, must come to understand the value of obeying God in light of His timing and leadership in their life.
Sin of man is such a big issue to God - He tries to help His people see how big an issue it is to Him, so by His grace and power they will walk in His Spirit and not fulfill the lust of the flesh.
Religious rules, when exposed to the power of God's grace, put to shame those who hold the rules as the way to please God.
Those who walk with God have the advantage of being able by God's grace to see circumstances from His point of view.
Those who are part of God's family should not despise or hate others who by God's grace receive more or better in this life than them.
Christ-followers should have balance in their life - balancing obligations with acts of mercy and grace.
Those of God who have acquired much should realize their possessions are by God's grace to them.
Those in Christ are not to presume upon God's mercy and grace.
Those in Christ who know God has helped them (given them grace) acknowledge their THANKSGIVING to God.
When a leader's ministry is called into question, it is good when he can say, 'I ministered in simplicity, sincerity, and by God's grace.'
Those who see themselves as underserving are filled with gratitude when God pours on them His mercy and grace.
Unless God gives grace through His Spirit, it seems those dedicated to one leader will have difficulty with his successor.
Those who experience God answering their prayers are (1) humbled, (2) praise God, and (3) credit God's mercy and grace.
Even when those who behave so wickedly are confronted by God's Word and thus humble themselves, God may grant more mercy and grace to them.
Those who walk by faith in the ways of the LORD will know the blessings (graces) God grants him.
Those in Christ who receive abundant revelations must avoid exaltation and rest upon the grace and power of God as he lives out his life before others.
God takes a person or a people from nothingness and in His sovereign mercy and grace makes them His people.
Those whose hearts are broken by the LORD's mercy and grace will fall on the LORD for His mercy and grace while the hard-hearted will suffer when the LORD destroys them.
Our prayers with God (absent of hiding one's sins) will find God hearing and answering in His time and way as well as find their way into our testimony of God's grace toward us.
Without God's sustaining grace, provision, and presence, the soul of each one who trust in Him would be destitute.
God exercises mercy and grace to all.
God extends mercy and grace to such undeserving people because of the promises He has made.
God's judgment and justice are perfect and certain as are His mercy, atonement, and grace.
'A grace of God on a huge project involving lots of people' is when God grants to them 'a mind (determined mindset) to work (the work).'
What is this grace and heart that fears (respects) God that is found in Job?
God may release painful consequences on His disobedient ones who reject His repeated rebukes, but grant mercy and grace on those who humble themselves afterward.
It is a terrible thing with a horrible outcome to reject (trample underfoot) the blood of Jesus Christ and insult the Spirit of grace.
Children of God offer to God offerings (the cost or the value of) which reflect the magnitude of the love they have for God - recognizing His mercy and grace.
There are some who have by God's grace a very potent sense of fearing God - holding God in awe and thus walk in obedience to God.
Oh, that those who are in the LORD would seek Him with humble hearts and tears and a testimony of obedience that God by His grace may grant their requests.
Men spend money on so many things that do not satisfy them while ignoring God, His Word, and grace which satisfies real thirst and real hunger.

Though God's people develop pride and stubbornness, because of God's covenant with them, He reaches out to them through oppression and sufferings to humble them that He might again rescued them in His mercy and grace.
It is such a blessing to be a recipient of God's abundant grace; to share it with others and have respect of God's people.
God comes to those who are not His and are following other gods to extend to such His mercy and grace.
Some who have received God's mercy and grace turned from God despising Him and His ways - who at one point (without repentance) God will judge severely.
Christ-followers are responsible to God for managing or handling the grace gifts He sends.
Christ-followers are to be hospitable to one another - without grumbling - sharing with one another since all are grace recipients.
Even those standing in persecution and suffering as God's children are recipients of God's grace.
The Holy Spirit of God - not might or power - brings into being the will of God as He brought forth Jesus Christ - God's grace.
God is the source of all grace to His children and the One who called us into His family and service.
God poured out the Holy Spirit of grace and prayer on the believing Jews immediately following Jesus' crucifixion.
A Christ-following husband is to be understanding of his wife, respecting and honoring her, because she is an heir also of the grace of life from God.
A Christ-following husband who fails to relate to his wife with understanding, honor, and grace will see his prayers hindered.
Those newborn believers who have tasted the grace of God should be encouraged by spiritual leaders to take in (eat) the Word of God - so they can grow.
God resists the proud, but gives grace to the humble.
God extends mercy, grace, and faithfulness to His children who have been unfaithful.
Grace is available to all peoples - anyone who will humble himself and trust in the LORD.
There is mercy and grace available in the LORD to all who seek Him.
Disciples of Jesus are to walk in a grace-relationship with the LORD - looking to and depending on the LORD.
Most societies expect the well-to-do to be in God's graces.
The most horrible of days of mankind are in the future, but God will show mercy and grace to His own.
The LORD measures out to His disciples the grace gift(s) He chooses.
The LORD gives varying amounts of grace to each disciple.

Spiritual leaders pray that their disciples will always speak (to unsaved or saved people) with grace - even speak attractively, tastily, and that they will know how to answer each one who inquirers or who they encounter.
Christ is the One who died for man's sins, was buried, arose again, and gives grace according to His measure.
Since disciples of Jesus received Christ by grace through faith in God's Word - they walk daily by grace through faith in God's Word.
Heaven decides the grace that will be given to each one born into God's family.
The truth of God's Word brings hope and brings forth fruit to those who receive it by God's grace.
Followers of Jesus should speak to others what is edifying - imparting grace to others.
Spiritual leaders desire God's grace and peace to be the experience of those Christ-followers to whom they minister.
Every disciple of Jesus receives one or more grace gifts.
Grace is given to each believer - follower of Christ -according to the measure of Christ's grace.
God's grace teaches followers of Christ to live sound-mindedly, right-living from God's viewpoint and God-centered - denying ungodliness and worldly longings.
Faithful ministers of God teach others the grace of God in truth.
Each disciple of Jesus is appointed to bear fruit - be productive according to the gifts of grace.
Christ-followers are to protect their mind, be sober (thoughtful), and rest their hope (expectation) fully upon God's grace to be realized at Christ's coming.
Eternal salvation is a grace gift from God to those who believe Him - take Him at His Word.
God's grace teaches followers of Christ to deny ungodliness and worldly desires.
God's grace teaches followers of Christ to live soberly (thoughtfully), righteously, and God-centered (now) while focused on Christ and His return with glory.
Disciples of Jesus have the privilege of abounding (abundant, overflowing) in the grace of giving as they do in the grace of faith, speaking, knowledge, diligence, and in loving others.
Salvation comes through God's grace, not man's efforts.
Giving to meet the needs of others is an act of grace - led by the Spirit of God.

This body of each Christ-follower is to reflect Who resides therein; holy place (dedicated), presence of God, witness to all who encounter it, communion with God, place of sacrifice, place of cleansing, place of power and victory, place of separation, place many others can see or watch, place of intercession, place of peace, place or hub of learning things of God, place where God speaks, place where sins are confessed, place of mercy and grace, identified as belonging to God as in ownership and authority.
There is no reason a follower of Christ needs to fear (anxious) because of the peace the LORD 'grace gifts' to His own.
The LORD grants the grace gift of peace to those who follow Him.
Interceding for God's presence and grace on others is a blessing to them.
Grace-oriented leaders pray for God's grace to be realized by others.
The most valued grace and peace on earth comes from (out of) having God as one's Father and having Jesus as one's LORD.
Spiritual leaders and all other Christ-followers are OF GRACE.
God's grace includes His work in each disciple to ignite the will of the disciple and to energize into action (ministry) the life of the disciple to do what produces pleasure for God.
Peace comes from knowing experientially that grace rules - life with God is not about performance.
Spiritual leaders know that our progress in the LORD is based on God's grace in Christ Jesus.
The joy and gladness of experiencing  God's grace is greater by far than the earthbound happiness of material success.
The spiritually privileged may not be the ones who come to Jesus in faith with gratitude, but the underprivileged who receive and know by experience His grace.
Those outwardly the most underserving give great glory to God when they receive God's grace.
Jesus had such holy boldness and grace as to be able to eat his last meal with the one who would betray Him.
A long time recipient of grace may begin to take the same for granted.
Christ-followers are to walk in Christ - live a grace-oriented life.
Strength by God's grace is essential for ministry - real lasting, multiplying ministry.
Christian privileges and grace duties are to be carried out with a heart toward God - not for public display.
Christ-followers need not return evil for evil, but instead minister grace to those who do evil to them.
Newer believers need reminded by spiritual leaders what grace is and that they are IN the grace.
Christ-followers are to be on watch lest anybody try to persuade them to live according to anyone or anything other than the grace of God in Christ.
God resists the proud. God gives grace to the humble.
God is gracious. God is the source of all grace.
The only right motive for exercising Christian privileges and grace duties is 'unto the LORD.'
Christ-followers may even extend grace to persons who demand something or request something by giving MORE than requested or demanded.
All those in the grace of God are the elect of God.
Love, blessings, grace, acts of service, and intercession are to be given to our enemies, persecutors, and abusers.
As God gives sunshine and rain to the saved and the unsaved, so Christ's disciples are to give love and grace to the saved and unsaved.
God's servants accomplish huge God-given assignments because God is with them - giving of His grace and power.
Ministries prosper due to the grace of God toward those ministries.
The magnitude of prosperity or success experienced by a ministry is related to the magnitude of God's grace toward that ministry.
God gives grace to His chosen servants cowering in their assignment.
Believers are justified by God's grace and possess the real hope of eternal life.
Responses to proclaiming God's Word will vary according to God's grace.
Liberty through grace is not to be used as a license to the flesh.
God's grace is poured out on the life of a leader who seeks God through a broken heart.
Such external restraints are nothing less than forms of 'works, religion, external laws, legalism, and NOT of grace.
Disciples of Jesus are to be grounded in grace and standing fast in the liberty grace brings.
God saves men according to what He wants to do through the grace He exhibits through Jesus Christ.
God's kind of love is so full of grace.
Spiritual leaders lean upon the grace or favor of God.
God's plan and purpose in Jesus Christ reveal that grace, not works, is the means by which God will work.
Spiritual leaders want their protégés to be strong in the LORD - knowing and serving out of grace.
Those who have received God's Grace should walk carefully.
God should be praised for every act of grace He bestows on His children.
The redeemed of the LORD will not be ashamed or disgraced forever and ever.
God came in Jesus Christ through the Holy Spirit to minister salvation and grace to all who will receive them.
Those who will trust in Christ to meet a real need may come to Him until He extends mercy and grace.
Those who have received God's grace and manifest power want to be near the LORD.
Christ-followers have a story of God's grace to 'Go' and 'Tell.'
Those who receive grace - and know it - share grace with others.
Exposure to God's Word with receptivity operated by God's grace results in confession of sin, prayer, fasting, and worship.
God gives grace to those who walk humbly toward Him.
Those who walk in obedience to God should treat one another with financial grace.
People who receive God's mercy and grace find it VERY DIFFICULT not to tell others about what God did.
God gives grace to those who walk uprightly.
Gains and victories in this life come by God's grace.
Those who experience God's forgiveness following repentance and confession can teach others about God's mercy and grace.
topics: Repentance, confession, teach, God's mercy, grace

results.text: Oh, the privilege, joy, and grace extended to see the LORD.
Humility before God will bring God's mercy and grace.
God's hand (grace) is involved in people being drawn to Him.
A child may disgrace her parents by living as an ungodly, immoral person.
When abundantly graced by God, people must be careful NOT to forget God.
This saving grace was at work before the beginning of time.
Worldly wisdom and God's grace are in contrast to each other.
Grace and peace originate in and come out from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace and peach originate 'in' and come out 'from' God the Father and Jesus Christ the LORD.
In all this - the name of the LORD will be glorified because of God's active grace.
Christ-followers are to conduct themselves genuinely and in holiness by - through the means of - God's grace.
Christ-followers are not saved and called to a holy life because of anything done by them, but because of God's own purpose and grace.
This is a day of God's grace and salvation.
God's grace at work in people being saved results in God being glorified.
God's grace can be manifested by Christ-followers experiencing extreme poverty yet prompted in heart to give an offering to help others.
Christ-followers should never take God's grace for granted
God scatters His grace and favor in so many lives and situations.
God is more than able to grace a sacrificial giver so that all his or her needs are met  and so that all God's work can be accomplished.
God may grant economic and spiritual grace to those who give out of their poverty and willing heart to those He directs.
God's grace is sufficient to meet the needs of His children.
People can be so out of touch with the LORD they fail to give Him credit for the ministry (grace) He gives them.
Weaknesses, insults, hardships, persecutions and difficulties in the life of an obedient Christ-follower give God opportunities to manifest His grace and power.
Though the sins of God's people may be great, He gives grace to them.
Those who cling to worthless idols forfeit the grace that could be theirs.
God, because of His grace, gives His people many opportunities to repent of repeated sin.
Christ-followers can be creative about how they give testimony to the LORD and His grace.
Those who have received God's abundant grace can be found glorifying and praising Him in prayer.
Some spiritual leaders may defile God's name while others grow in grace and favor with God and men.
When the LORD answers the prayers of a Christ-follower, that Christ-follower should take advantage of opportunities to give testimony of God's grace in answering his or her prayers.
Giving of thanks and praise ought to come quickly to those who have received God's great grace.
Those God puts in leadership should practice grace.
Grace is a beautiful gift from a leader.
Those who - like dead dogs, undeserving - have received God's rich grace know something of what it is like to sit at the kings table.
The Christ-followers with great means can be glad that God gives them His grace to humbly recognize it is the size of their heart toward Him that counts not the size of their bank account.
Lewd, disgraceful, and vile behavior on the part of some of God's people should provoke all God's people to hold such people accountable.
The gospel of grace was given to (entrusted) Christ-followers to maintain and communicate.
Grace prompts gratitude.
God's grace and calling may catch some by surprise.
