It is the intimacy one has with the LORD in his spirit or inner man that impacts his life the most.
God interacts on a grace basis with the prayers of those IN CHRIST who walk intimately with Him.
God wants all peoples - even idol worshipping peoples - to know He acts independently and sovereignly so they can look to Him in faith.
Christ-followers are to avoid both murder and sexual assaults or abuses in acts and in their imaginations.

What the temple in Jerusalem was to those under the Abrahamic covenant, so the heart - inner man, soul and more specifically the spirit - is to those under the new covenant of the body and blood of Jesus Christ: (1) 12:5, the place God makes His name to dwell, a holy place and meeting place, John 4:23, 14:23; Ephesians 1:13-14, (2) 12:11, the place God makes His name abide, where the character of Christ is formed and reflected, Galatians 4:19, 5:22-23, (3) 12:18, the place we receive, recognize, and rejoice over all God has given us, a depository of spiritual and heavenly communiques, 2 Peter 1:1-5, (4) 12:21, the place to exercise gratitude in enjoying and expressing all God has provided, gratitude 1 Thessalonians 5:18, (glory) 1 Corinthians 10:31, humility James 4:6, within the boundary of His Word Colossians 3:16; 2 Timothy 3:16-17, Psalm 119:9-16, (5) 12:26, the place reserved for holiness (clean) and offerings (service of self and giftings) to the LORD from a motive of love toward God, Mark 12:28-30; Romans 12:1; Acts 13:22 (example).
Trusting God acts now in accordance with what God will do.
A judge or arbitrator among God\'s people is to be honest and just by avoiding bribes and judging all disputes on the merits of the facts.
It is God\'s righteousness (right acts) that brings forth praise from those whose heart is right toward God.
Those IN CHRIST are not to enter into marriages or other binding contracts with those who are not in Christ - who through intimacy of relationship might well turn one away from following Christ.
God\'s sovereignty and power are manifests when He speaks and acts.
In acts of judgment leading to His purposes, God chooses when and how to differentiate between His people and others.
Those without a relationship with God often do acts of kindness and mercy in an attempt to appease their guilty conscience.
God\'s merciful and gracious acts toward people produce \'wonder\' in the people toward God.
Some love-motivated acts in behalf of another may cost the actor much.
God speaks and acts to demonstrate His faithfulness that His people might believe Him so they will obey Him in doing His will.
God sovereignly acts to deliver His chosen servant until that one\'s purpose(s) is fulfilled.
With multiple manifestations of God Himself in a localized area where God\'s Word is proclaimed daily, there comes a holy awe or fear of God that impacts the people of the local area.
Declare and teach God\'s Word that fruit may come: salvation, Romans 10:9-17, Spirit, Galatians 5:22-23, and Righteousness, Hebrews 12:11 and Philippians 1:11.
Some families in Christ are greatly graced by God to have multiple one's in public service to the LORD.
A local assembly, moved by God in a revival setting, may make a commitment to a self-imposed agreed upon annual gift to the LORD's work or service.

Those in humble faithful service to God may be (1) made a spectacle, (2) condemned to death, (3) fools, (4) weak, (5) dishonored, (6) hungry, thirsty, (7) poorly clothed, (8) beaten, (9) homeless, (10) laboring, (11) reviled, (12) persecuted, (13) defamed, (14) filth of the world, and / or (15) offscouring.
The new covenant consist of life in Christ by the Holy Spirit; whose ministry (service out of) is much more glorious than that of Moses.
A deep personal revival (experience) with the LORD commonly manifest in generous gifts to the LORD or the LORD's service.
Under previous covenants olive oil was used to anoint one for the LORD's service - whereas today, the Holy Spirit's indwelling brings the anointing in the inner man.
God may raise to prominent service of a foreign king one of His faithful, humble, trusting servants - even an exile in a foreign land.
Greatness in God's kingdom is determined by humble, Spirit-led service to others in Jesus' name.
When you move out in love to serve the LORD, He will provide for you so you can advance in your service.
Those who serve the LORD should not seek greatness, but service in the name of the LORD.
God's call to service can come to an educated exile in a foreign land (like Daniel), a Carpenter in a small village, or a sheepherder - it is still God's gracious call to service.
Hypocrisy - pretending to be honestly religious or right with God - is a great offense to God - 'lip service' without actions consistent to validate what is said or implied.
So many Christ-followers are like James and John - they are looking for or hoping for positions of influence or prestige rather than looking for and hoping for platforms for service to others.
Humility and service to others is the hallmark of those who follow Christ - not greatness and position.
The LORD chooses those who will serve Him from among all those who follow Him and appoints to specific service those He chooses.
How glad am I when I consider going into God's presence - not just attending a church service?
God chooses His servants and appoints them for service as He wills - even giving them the message He wants them to carry in His name.
The spiritual qualifications for service in the body of Christ - service of food distribution - might be (1) good reputation, (2) full of the Holy Spirit, and (3) full of wisdom.
Christ-followers called out by the body of Christ should be (1) set before the spiritual leaders, (2) prayed over, and (3) lay hands on as they are commission to service.
Among whom God's name is 'great,' such people are found with faith in God (praying) and service to God (presenting offerings, surrendering).
Christ-followers are not to be pursuing greatness as a person, but pursue service - serving the greater number of people.
Serving the LORD is great and important, but preceding service comes the need to know and relate to the LORD.
When Christ-followers obey the LORD, they should not think they need or deserve an immediate reward from the LORD - the reward will follow when the service is completed.
It is fowl play and sinful for sure to offer God cheap, invaluable aspects of our life and inferior service.
God's service requires faithfulness - integrity to do what is established honestly and consistently.
Those in Christ who know and recognize God's grace in their life - excelling in whatever they do for God's glory - may be raised up to new and higher opportunities of service.
God calls some to His service before they are conceived in the womb - glory to God.
Service by a servant of God in the power of God and name of God is to bring glory to God.
Your faithful and obedient Spirit-filled service may get you exiled to a remote place for many years.
God is the one who equips and empowers His chosen servants for service - no need to fear, only trust and obey.
Christ-followers would do well to 'Barnabas' others in the family of God - to Barnabas one is to encourage them by helping them find their place in God's family and service.
Experiencing God's new birth in Christ can transform us from be unprofitable to profitable as far as service in God's family or kingdom.
A testimony of faithfulness in the matters of service to the LORD is a valuable character trait.
Women of God ought to be women of prayer everywhere with lives adorned with good  works (service to others as unto the LORD) - not bothering so much with adorning the body or external beauty.
Service to God is out of obedience by faith so that people will come to know that God is God, Savior, and LORD for His glory.
Many years of loyal service to the LORD can be spoiled - diminished, over-written - by a prideful outburst (any sinful attitude or action) near the end of one's life or ministry.
A servant shows (or proves) he is bold, faithful, and merciful (like his God) when he puts his life on the line in the service of the LORD.
What is in the heart of one who loves God may only come to pass - due to God's will - in the life and service of another of God's servants.
God's kingdom is not built on greatness, but on service with humility.
Greatness in God's kingdom is measured by service to others - truly serving others in Jesus' name.
Like the angels, man and woman in Christ AFTER the resurrection are not in marriage relationships - simply in service to the LORD God Almighty.
When a child of God serves another (as an employee or a contractor), the service rendered should be the highest quality - fully a job well done.
Some of those in the service of the LORD are 'very able' while others might be very simple yet Spirit-filled - making the latter 'heavenly able.'
Those who have obeyed God by faith need still to walk with God in a love-relationship with God - through the intimacy of this relationship comes continued obedience, faithfulness, and service.
Those who are ministers of reconciliation do so as CALLED servants of God (as a ministry, a service) no matter the circumstances or outcomes.
The LORD establishes the spiritual leaders (as He wills) in the service of His people.
A 'priest for hire' ought not to be since it is God who calls and assigns men of God to service for Himself.
Being a proclaimer (apostle, prophet, evangelist, pastor, teacher) without receiving PAY FOR SERVICES puts one in a position of freedom from slanting the message toward the ears of the hearers.
With every opportunity, do good (things, works, service, and acts out of love) to all, especially to the household of faith.
God's designed basis of a relationship with Him is for His people to love Him and out of that love would come worship, service, and obedience by faith.
Those who will serve the LORD are to consecrate themselves to the LORD and His service.
God's Spirit gives God's obedient (by faith) servants directions to go in life and service.
All who serve the LORD (formally or informally; recognized by men or not) need to be anointed for such service by God's Spirit.
There is no substitute for prayer in the worship, honor, or service of our LORD.
Not all doors of service God opens are of the same magnitude of opportunity - sensitive-to-the-Spirit servants recognize what God opens.
To express God's kind of love (having received it and filled with it) is the undergirding of all service in Christ's name.
God's calling to service involves (1) His choosing you, (2) His being with you, and (3) Him giving you another heart.
Communion with God provokes greater love for the LORD which brings about service to the  LORD.
The body of a Christ-follower is to be fully dedicated to God so that all that transpires in the body is in service to the will of God.
Those God appoints to His service are to obey God's Word, seek godly counsel, and seek God in prayer.
God calls certain people to serve Him in certain ways and He tells the church to 'separate' them to that service.
Those whose service of obedience finds hardship and suffering continue faithfully that God's glory may be manifested.
One's service to the LORD is impacted by the marriage relationship (or lack of) at a particular time.
Failure to express God's love, regardless of my service, voids all profit to me.
It is not unusual that God would involve many in service to Him; some 'up front' and many behind the scenes with small but real parts.
There are those among God's servants who lack proper (spiritual, God's) lineage and thus should be excluded from this service.
God's wisdom expressed in and through a Christ-follower has these characteristics: (1) pure, (2) peaceable, (3) gentle, (4) submissive, (5) merciful service, (6) impartial, and (7) sincere.

Even if a faithful servant becomes discouraged and considers not being faithful any longer (though remaining in communion with God) God can fill one's heart with a burning (necessary) message - greatly compelling the service to continue.
'God's people' who are out of fellowship with God are self-deceived to think they can offer God some kind of second-class service and God won't know it or will not care that much.
God is the source of all grace to His children and the One who called us into His family and service.
God establishes an intimate relationship with those He chooses and appoints in His service.
Demon possessed people can participate in religious services without issue unless the Spirit of God is present.
Greatness in God's kingdom is measured by service not position or rank.
Acts of love and service by those in intimate closeness with the LORD may intimidate or bring resentment by those whose love or intimacy with the LORD is less.
The work and service of a follower of Christ is done as service to the LORD because it is the LORD who rewards His own.
A desire to give away your life to others as a service to the LORD is an honorable desire, verified so by the LORD.
Spiritual leaders see themselves as being poured out as a drink offering in service to those they lead.
Service to others may be at the expense of one's own well being - even one's own life.
Those disciples who abandon others during difficulty do a great disservice to themselves, other disciples, and the name of Christ.
Service to the LORD is to be characterized by righteousness, peace, and joy in the Holy Spirit.
Greatness in God's kingdom is service to others - as Jesus modeled.
Service in the kingdom of God - especially the church - is to be marked by humility.
Service to others trumps greatness - most influential or most powerful - in Christ's body, the church.
There is a time when learning from Jesus of one's relationship with Jesus supersedes mundane service activities.
Leaders in God's kingdom or the church are to be marked by humility - an attitude of service to others.
God's blessings and rewards for service in His name may come only at the resurrection, but the rewards WILL COME.
Disciples of Jesus aspire to service NOT greatness.
God works among even influential leaders of opposing religious traditions to call people into His service.
Loyalty and committed service cannot be divided between surrender to God and surrender to material gain.
Love, blessings, grace, acts of service, and intercession are to be given to our enemies, persecutors, and abusers.
A man's focus or service cannot be divided between God and earthly attractions.
Willful service can be seen in receiving or welcoming a child  -relatively insignificant in society.
Jesus trained His disciples, loved His disciples, paid the ultimate sacrifice for His disciples, and demonstrated to His disciples the attitude of service they were to carry forth.
Disciples and surely leaders are to walk worthy of their calling and service.
Love, service, and sacrifice are the order of the day for followers of Jesus.
Disciples may have greater experiences ahead - in service - than currently they could ever grasp.
Some who don't even know what is going on may be drafted by God for service to Christ's body.
Those who serve the LORD passionately and sacrificially may also experience miracles in their service.
Faithful service is rewarded.
Leaders select faithful people to fill positions of service.
Some assignments in service to the LORD are very specific.
A spiritual leader or servant moving to a new place of service is to be cared for by God's people in the new place.
Spiritual leaders can transfer leadership to the next generation in public service.
A demon possessed man may attend religious services.
God has people prepared to call into training for service.
Those with a heart for God give Him service, thanksgiving, and praise.
Confession of sin and cleansing from sin precede a divine call to service.
topics: Cleansing, sin, precede divine call, service

results.text: There are many assignments in God's service.
Some of God's service is behind the scenes - other service is out front where others see it and hear it.
There is submission and authority at work in God's service.
Ministers who assist ministers of God are still involved in God's service.
In God's service both groups and the individuals within are recognized.
Servants God uses greatly may follow in a family line where others abused or mocked God's service.
God desires willing devotion and service.
Those who serve the LORD surrender to do 'whatever' He brings to them in their service.
Disobedience to God in God's service can be costly.
God gives some leaders of His people long terms of service.
Consecration of oneself comes before service.
Preparation precedes service.
Those who show understanding in God's service need encouraged to 'go on.'
Religious service and devotion is to be focused toward God alone - no other god.
My foundational attitude in relating to others is to be 'service.'
Christ's love compels Christian ministry and service.
Though hardships of many kinds come to Christ-followers in active, obedient service, Christ Jesus is always present to manifest Himself and His life in the Christ-followers.
Some in God's family don't answer affirmatively the first call to service.
Some need to be recruited by name for service.
Seeking of the LORD requires (1) rid self of other gods and sins, (2) committing of oneself to the LORD, and (3) service with devotion to the LORD.
Sometimes those serving as God's ministers must be removed from service.
There can be a celebration when one is called into service by God.
The LORD appoints people in His service who were once blasphemers, persecutors, and violent men.
Those who receive a call from God to full-time vocational service in ministry may well burn their bridges behind them.
When God gives a gift, it is to be given back to Him in service - used, made available for Him.
The hands (lives and service) of those praying are to be dedicated to God.
Christ-followers are to offer themselves once for all to God for His service.
As a priest of royal nature to the most high God, Christ-followers offer their own body, offer praise, offer their substance, and offer service.
Christ-followers are priests in the service of God.
The spiritually reasonable service of a Christ-follower is to offer his body as a living sacrifice to God.
When God wants to intervene in a live on bringing salvation so as to put one into His service, He can do it very well.
What a believer does, he does in service to Jesus is LORD.
Severe suffering may come to faithful, obedient service of Jesus Christ.
Pastors are to teach so as to prepare or equip the members of the body of Christ for works of service.
These gifted ones are to prepare for equip gods people to do  works of service in His name.
Lip service without a life service is no service.
When God wants a person in His service in a particular way or place for ministry, He goes about to get that person and put them where He wants them.
Those in authority are doing God's service and are agents of wrath on the wrong doers.
Each of the members of the body of Christ are gifted for service.
Those working in or around where God is at work find joy in that service.
Task in God's service can be broken down from the largest of overall to the smallest of minutia.
Spiritual leaders can give assignments to others and God's service.
There are places of service where two serve as one.
It is a serious matter for those in service to God to be blatantly disobey God.
God's service can be well-organized.
Public recognition of God's calling to service is valuable.
God calls His people to service.
The people as a whole should openly consecrate those called to service.
God directs His people to "set apart" publicly those called by Him into service.
Things to be used for service to God are consecrated to such service.
God wants to see service to Him passed on to future generations - involving the up and coming younger adults.
Attempting to usurp another's authority in God's service is a sin against God.
Spiritual leaders who go astray may be allowed some place of service in God's fellowship.
In Christ's kingdom - humility and service mark one as 'greater than.'
Only those whose hearts have been 'made right' can enter God's presence, be a part of God's family, and be involved in corporate service to God.

Those of God people who through crises keep their eyes on God, fearing and trusting God,  and humble themselves will likely (1) seek God and themselves more clearly, (2) have a richer relationship with God, and (3) be used in service by God.
Among Christ-followers, a desire for greatness should manifest itself in giving oneself In service to others.
Some faithful service to Christ have very short ministries - yet maybe very important in God's overall plan.
Loving the LORD results in Christ-followers giving money and possessions as well as service unto Him - in His name.
Some are selected to stewardship over valuables dedicated to God and His service.
Stewardship of one's possessions includes giving offerings to the LORD and His service.

In the body of Christ, there are those entrusted with (stewards of) (1) the resources or facilities of the LORD, (2) the service (carrying out of worship, care, teaching) of the LORD, and (3) the preservation of these two.
God's entrusted gifts for service and callings - when stewarded properly and as led - include the option to earn one's own expense money, receive gifts, or receive pay directly for their service.
The ministry or service of a Christ-follower is first and foremost a stewardship entrusted to them by God, Himself.
The blessing of the LORD is upon all IN CHRIST whose heart atitude remains 'service to all others.'

Spiritual leaders are to repeatedly teach and exhort the Christ-followers they influence (1) to consider those (even unbelievers) they work for worth respecting and honoring (2) expressing a good work ethic SO the name of God and the teachings of God may not be blasphemed AND those who work for believers (Christ-followers) (1) to not look down on (take advantage of) them just because they too follow Christ but (2) give them good service because believers and beloved are benefited.

There are those who profess or assent to know God but their lives are consistently contradictory to knowing God (destable, hard-headed, unpersuadable) such are disqualified, unworthy, rejected from spiritual service - especially from leadership roles.

Those IN CHRIST should thank the LORD for (1) His mercy (having been at enmity), (2) His grace and favor - being beyond numbering or over the top toward them, (3) His imparting ability to fulfill His will, (4) His considering them trustworthy, (5) His appointing each one a role and responsibility of service and all this accompanied by a supply of faith toward Him and love for Him and others.
Sometimes those who persecute faithful followers of Christ think they are doing a service to God.

Those IN CHRIST who faithfully fulfill their gifting and calling and experience suffering (incarceration, imprisonment) as part of the outcome are not ashamed of Christ nor their obedience BECAUSE they trust the LORD with a deep-heart persuasion  that God is faithful to keep, affirm, and reward the faithful service rendered in His name.
If it seems you are forgotten by others, continue faithfully in Christ for God has not forgotten you - a greater day of service will come.

Christ-followers are to let God\'s Word impact (1) their personal life day and night, (2) their family life (at the core of many daily discussions), (3) their vocation and service to others, (4) their thoughts and decisions - how they see life, and (5) their going out into the community and the relationships they have with all who know them.

What the temple in Jerusalem was to those under the Abrahamic covenant, so the heart - inner man, soul and more specifically the spirit - is to those under the new covenant of the body and blood of Jesus Christ: (1) 12:5, the place God makes His name to dwell, a holy place and meeting place, John 4:23, 14:23; Ephesians 1:13-14, (2) 12:11, the place God makes His name abide, where the character of Christ is formed and reflected, Galatians 4:19, 5:22-23, (3) 12:18, the place we receive, recognize, and rejoice over all God has given us, a depository of spiritual and heavenly communiques, 2 Peter 1:1-5, (4) 12:21, the place to exercise gratitude in enjoying and expressing all God has provided, gratitude 1 Thessalonians 5:18, (glory) 1 Corinthians 10:31, humility James 4:6, within the boundary of His Word Colossians 3:16; 2 Timothy 3:16-17, Psalm 119:9-16, (5) 12:26, the place reserved for holiness (clean) and offerings (service of self and giftings) to the LORD from a motive of love toward God, Mark 12:28-30; Romans 12:1; Acts 13:22 (example).
The perceived \'time delays\' the faithful in Christ experience are being used by God to further develop the faithful for greater service to the kingdom of God.
When two in a covenant relationship with God meet in service to God, they can relate to one another in a deep common bond of THAT RELATIONSHIP - it is a \'praise God\' meeting.

A society would do well to allow military deferments for a season to certain ones, but exclude from military service those who are full of fear and anxiety as such will spread through the troops and spoil the heart and mind of many.
Greatness in the kingdom of God is manifest in humble service to others.
The externally focused religionists are always around to attack Christ-followers for joining with the LORD to put emphasis upon a \'right heart\' and \'heart-deep\' faith and service.
Some (selected by God) in the body of Christ may be set apart for particular service to the LORD but not set \'above\' any other child of God.
God chooses people for certain tasks (one's He knows will fit the task) a Roman citizen could move about the Gentile world of the Romans easily and be protected by the government.
It was God's set purpose for Jesus to be handed over to the Jewish leaders and Romans to die on a cross.
These sinful actions will kill those who fail to kill them first (see also Romans 8:13).

What the temple in Jerusalem was to those under the Abrahamic covenant, so the heart - inner man, soul and more specifically the spirit - is to those under the new covenant of the body and blood of Jesus Christ: (1) 12:5, the place God makes His name to dwell, a holy place and meeting place, John 4:23, 14:23; Ephesians 1:13-14, (2) 12:11, the place God makes His name abide, where the character of Christ is formed and reflected, Galatians 4:19, 5:22-23, (3) 12:18, the place we receive, recognize, and rejoice over all God has given us, a depository of spiritual and heavenly communiques, 2 Peter 1:1-5, (4) 12:21, the place to exercise gratitude in enjoying and expressing all God has provided, gratitude 1 Thessalonians 5:18, (glory) 1 Corinthians 10:31, humility James 4:6, within the boundary of His Word Colossians 3:16; 2 Timothy 3:16-17, Psalm 119:9-16, (5) 12:26, the place reserved for holiness (clean) and offerings (service of self and giftings) to the LORD from a motive of love toward God, Mark 12:28-30; Romans 12:1; Acts 13:22 (example).
Declare and teach God\'s Word that fruit may come: salvation, Romans 10:9-17, Spirit, Galatians 5:22-23, and Righteousness, Hebrews 12:11 and Philippians 1:11.
A devoted (to the LORD) offering cannot be (1) taken back, (2) sold, or (3) redeemed because it is most holy to the LORD - even as it applies to the offering of one\'s self in Romans 12:1.

God sends His selected servants to proclaim Christ through the Scriptures so He can (1) open the hearer's eyes, (2) turning the hearers from darkness to light, (3) from the power of Satan to God, (4) receive forgiveness of sins, and (5) receive an inheritance (spiritual) among all who are set apart by trusting in Christ.
Those who are forgiven much by the LORD and His salvation (forgiveness) are the ones who love Him much - and, oh how He loves them!
Turn away from a life of sin and disobedience to trust God through Jesus for (1) forgiveness, and (2) walking in His ways.
The kingdom of God is characterized as a place of mercy and forgiveness.
Those who have sinned greatly and suffered - having trusted in God for salvation with forgiveness - will sing and testify of God's mercy.
Those who have experienced God's mercy, forgiveness, and salvation are known to give Him thanks - expressing deep gratitude.
Those who see God's real work and identify it as Satan's work - blaspheming against the Holy Spirit - will not experience forgiveness from God.
Those who think they know SO MUCH about God, but speak inadequately of Him may find themselves being taught and corrected by God Himself and sent to those they criticized to ask forgiveness.
Forgiveness of sins and justification before God are both found in Jesus Christ, the Savior of all who believe.
Turning to Jesus in faith for salvation results in forgiveness of sins and times of refreshing in communion with the LORD.
Those in relationship with God as Father seek God's forgiveness for their sins while granting the same forgiveness to those who have offended them.

Every Christ-follower should ask himself or herself the question, 'How grateful am I toward the LORD considering all He has forgiven in granting me forgiveness in Jesus Christ?'  And, 'Am I showing the LORD my appropriate level of gratitude and love?'
The righteous among the rebellious may be moved by God's Spirit to confess all sins and plead with God for forgiveness based on His mercy and His name's sake.
God brings new life - including forgiveness, cleansing, new hearts, etc. - to those who trust in Him and He does so for His name's sake - not theirs.
Christ-followers would do well to agree with God's Spirit and God's Word when convicted by the same of sin - thereby we have forgiveness and walk in righteousness.
Revival comes as pastors, leaders, and those returning to the LORD submit themselves to the LORD as humble sinners depending on God's forgiveness through His appointed Sacrifice.
Those who represent God to others (preaching the Gospel, declaring the need of salvation, and forgiveness of sins) must also find (know) salvation from their sins in the LORD.

Those in Christ are selected by God, set apart for God, and loved so much by God - thus, they are to put on or incorporate increasingly in their new life tender mercies, kindness, humility, meekness, long-suffering, forbearance, forgiveness, be loving, peaceful, and thankful.
Those in Christ have complete redemption through His blood, which includes forgiveness of sins in an amount equal to the rich richness of His grace.
God does reach out to those who have sinned that He might restore them to Himself through the means of repentance and forgiveness.
Christ-followers are to be a forgiving, mercy-granting family toward all those who ask for forgiveness.
Seeking forgiveness follows confession of sin.
The resurrection of Jesus Christ is vital to our salvation and the forgiveness of our sins.
This symbolizes what God does through the forgiveness He grants in atonement - the sins of those forgiven are put away as far as the east is from the west or at the bottom of the ocean.
Forgiveness of offenses is one of the signs that identifies a child of God (a faith-walker).
Process to forgiveness - commit sin, guilt of sin, confession of sin, apply costly offerings (apply atonement of Lamb of God), and experience forgiveness.
Grateful, loving recipients of God's love and forgiveness will sacrifice to express such to Jesus.
Damaging relationships with other disciples grieves God's Spirit and ignores or belittles the forgiveness given us by God in Christ.
God's forgiveness of a believer's sins was complete, comprehensive, and continuing through the life and vicarious death of Jesus.
Forgiveness from God and love for God are linked.
Those who receive forgiveness from God are to give forgiveness to those who have wronged them.
Retaining an offense against others - not forgiving them - will prevent you from knowing new forgiveness from God.
Large love comes out of large forgiveness.
Willfully allowing a wrong to persist without pursuing forgiveness precludes honest worship of God.
Others need to know the forgiveness of God that they may know such love.
Repentance and forgiveness of sins are linked.
There is no hope of forgiveness for those who revile the Spirit of God and His work.
Forgiveness is requisite among disciples of Jesus Christ.
God's forgiveness experienced elicits awe and respect from the recipients.
Those who experience God's forgiveness following repentance and confession can teach others about God's mercy and grace.
topics: Repentance, confession, teach, God's mercy, grace

results.text: Real forgiveness comes through the blood of a sinless sacrifice - Jesus Christ.
Forgiveness and atonement require blood - the blood of Jesus Christ ONLY.
Leaders find forgiveness with God the same as all others - Christ's blood.
Atonement and forgiveness only come through the blood of Jesus Christ.
Forgiveness is associated with shedding of blood - the blood of Jesus Christ.
There is forgiveness available from God for those who acknowledge their sins to God.
To make right a wrong (sin) toward another person requires (1) confession of the wrong, (2) restitution to the one wronged, and then (3) experience forgiveness from God.
Sin and its guilt must be dealt with God's way to know forgiveness.
Christ-followers forgive others based on Christ's forgiveness.
God's forgiveness comes out of His love.
Great is the day when rebels return to the LORD - seeking forgiveness, offering praise to the Lord, openly acknowledging God only can save, and rejecting all false gods.
Jesus gave Himself - His life - in order to provide forgiveness for men's sins.
Christ-followers are to practice forgiveness the same way God forgives them.
God has provided a salvation that includes a personal relationship with Him and complete forgiveness of sins.
There is no forgiveness between God and man without the shedding of blood.
Forgiveness on a spiritual level - in reality -  is a very serious matter.
When one experiences true forgiveness, they will no longer feel guilt over their sins.
True forgiveness releases guilt for sins.
All are in need of a means of forgiveness, holiness, reconciliation, and atonement.
Forgiveness of others who have offended us is an important matter to God.
Those who express repentance and faith toward God receive forgiveness of their sins and the gift of the Holy Spirit.
Those who have experienced God's salvation and forgiveness know joy and gladness.
Jesus Christ gives repentance and forgiveness of sins.
All who believe on Jesus Christ to receive forgiveness of their sins through His name.
When one realizes the magnitude of the forgiveness from God in his salvation, that's one will unashamedly love the LORD.
Faith in the person and work of Christ results in forgiveness of one sins.
The blessing of forgiveness (salvation) is for those who have been circumcised and those who have not been circumcised if both have expressed faith in God's redemption plan.
Forgiveness comes through the blood (work of Jesus) of Jesus Christ.
The church is not to allow (1) those with false beliefs about where forgiveness comes from or (2) those who continued in immorality to remain among them - be part of the church.
Appealing for mercy and forgiveness are based on God's nature of love.
Forgiveness is only achieved through a sinless sacrifice - Jesus.
Forgiveness is to be a constant practice by Christ-followers.
Christ-followers only have to realize how much God has forgiven in them if they would hold back forgiveness from another.
Christ-followers are exhorted to seek and give forgiveness in order to heal or restore relationships.
The forgiveness toward an offender that Christ calls for is a forgiveness 'from the heart' - a sincere, from the inner man forgiveness.
Granting forgiveness to an offender who repents restores a relationship, while refusing to grant forgiveness breaks or hinders a relationship.
Those who give forgiveness, give mercy, and avoid condemning those who wrong them will receive the same from others - mercy, forgiveness, and lack of condemnation.
The unsaved need to be told to turn from their sin toward God in faith to receive the forgiveness of their sin.
The emotional and physical toll of sin is lifted and replaced with forgiveness and rejoicing in those who confess (admit) their sin to God.
To sin in ignorance is certainly still sin and requires atonement and forgiveness - thus, these sins are a portion of those carried by Jesus on the cross.
Like the Aaronic priests of old, Christ-followers should be doubly sensitive to sin and its required atonement, confession, and forgiveness.
Those who know (by experience) God\'s salvation with forgiveness will give thanks to Him forever and show forth praise to God to the next generation.
'Abundance of hope' comes by the power of the Holy Spirit and patience with comfort of the Scriptures.
God's patience and mercy toward His disobedient people has a limit.
Our God is a God of mercy, patience, and purpose.
The Holy Spirit in a Christ-follower produces love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, and self-control.
Who says the Old Testament fails to speak of God's mercy and grace, kindness and patience?
As the LORD's revelation of Himself and His instructions cannot be delivered at one time, but must be spread out over time, SO ALSO disciple makers must teach with patience their disciples over time.
It is impatience and shortsightedness that prompts a true prophet of God to ask God, 'Why are you not yet bringing judgment on these disobedient and rebellious people?'
Christ-followers must understand that God's delay in not fulfilling His Word of judgment as yet is only His patience and mercy allowing more people to be saved.
The patience (endurance) of man - not the wrath of man - in a trial produces righteousness (obedience by faith).

Spiritual leaders can encourage novice believers to consider it joyous overall when trials come, because the testing (putting into use over time) of faith produces patience (spiritual endurance) - which over time leads to becoming mature in Christ.
Older men in the body of Christ are to be sober minded, reverent, temperate (self-controlled), sound in faith (not fighting about), sound in love, and sound in patience.

Those in Christ with the responsibility of proclaiming God's Word (1) should do so when it is convenient and inconvenient, (2) should do so convincingly, (3) should do so to rebuke those making wrong choices, (4) should do so for the purpose of encouraging, and (5) should do so with patience using the avenue of teaching God's Word.
A spiritual leader would do well to flee from the pursuit of material things and pursue instead the great spiritual treasures of righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patience, and gentleness.
In God's salvation of some, He is demonstrating His patience and power to save such as an example to many others who will believe - God can do it.
God has granted to us the Scriptures so we can learn from them - which learning requires patience in the Scriptures and results in increased hope.
Spiritual leaders desire God will direct the heart of each Christ-follower into God's love and into walking in the patience of Christ.
Disciple makers cannot help but thank God when they hear their disciples are doing well in the LORD - loving one another and enduring with patience persecution.

Disciple makers and apostles have the privilege and opportunity to encourage those they are discipling by affirming their obedience to God, their motive of love, and their patience of hope in the LORD.
God's purpose (as ours too) is to sow the Word of God in order that fruit (that which is produced) will be produced - fruit will come over time (with patience).
Expressing impatience reveals a lack of real faith in God.
Knowing God's Word should bring patience and comfort to Christ-followers.
Various trials test the depth and breadth (authenticity) of our trust in God while producing patience (endurance) which leads to Christlike character development.
Those disciples raising up young disciples ask the LORD to grant the young all patience and longsuffering with joy.
Older believers in an assembly should behave soberly, reverently, and temperately while being sound in the faith, sound in love, and sound in patience.
Sound doctrine or teaching can lead to sound practices of faith, love, and patience.
God's patience comes to an end.
God may show great mercy and patience toward a people.
Patience involves standing firm in Christ.
Impatience on the part of leadership can bring devastating results.
Christ-followers need to remember that God's patience related to Christ's return means salvation for more people.
Spiritual leaders must minister the Word with great patience and careful instruction.
Christ-followers ought to imitate those among them who through faith and patience inherit what has been promised.
Christ-followers can and should express faith and patience in God.
These characteristics in a Christ-follower's life are produced by the Holy Spirit:  love, joy, peace, patience, gentleness, goodness, faithfulness, meekness, self-control.
Those given over to a depraved mind live on showing contempt for God's abundant kindness, tolerance, and patience.
Believers will experience affliction and opposition - in such they should exercise patience.
There are times when God's patience wears out toward His people.
There comes a time with God when patience meets wrath.

Christ-followers should flee away from love and devotion to money and its acquisition while out of love and devotion to God pursue and acquire righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patience, and gentleness.
Since the LORD saved Saul of Tarsus - blaphemer, persecutor, an insulant man - all in Christ today should be encouraged by that example of mercy, grace, and complete patience extended by our LORD.

Spiritual leaders (men of God) have an injunction to flee, shun, and abhore the headstrong or resolute pursuit of riches and many resources - instead focus on hunting down, pursuing and endeavoring for righteousness (doing what God says by faith), godliness (a God-ward mind, reverence, loving fear of God), ongoing trust in God, expressing of God's love, practicing patience (enduring under pressure), and gentleness (meekness, expressing power with reserve and gentleness), and fight (agonize) the good (worthwhile) fight related to the faith-walk of children of God.

Spiritual leaders are under an injunction to repeatedly speak what fits with or matches with sound, wholesome, or spiritually healthy teaching: older men in Christ (1) stay sober (abstaining from or rigidly moderate drinking wine), (2) practice self-control, (3) remain solid in the Gospel faith, (4) remain solid in expressing sacrificial love, and (5) remain solid in patience (enduring under pressure) - - - to be continued
To \"preach the Word\" involves public proclamation with patience and teaching (explaining) to convince, rebuke, and exhort (to call close beside).
The body of Christ urgently needs men to proclaim with patience and teaching (explanation) God\'s Word.
Ability to speak multiple languages (for a traveling servant of God) is an asset.
God connects His traveling faithful with 'brothers-in-Christ' along the way for edification, multiplication, and mutual fellowship.
Those who would spread the Gospel of the Kingdom would do well to travel through towns and villages in outer areas as well as key cities.
People in great numbers might travel a great distance at measurable inconvenience to receive genuine ministry from God through a Christ-follower.
The way of life is broad (most all are traveling toward destruction), but the way of life following Jesus is narrow (few find or enter this difficult life).
Hospitality of the people of God for one another (especially within a people group) is an encouragement as one travels.
Jesus traveled with His disciples - spending time with them and traveling as they did - normal conveyance.
Storms come to those traveling in the will of the LORD.
All believers need to witness of the gospel wherever they travel.
The LORD's assignment for some maybe to travel a great amount and great distances.
Meeting Christian brothers in distant lands while traveling is spiritually and emotionally encouraging.
Wherever Christ-followers assemble, live, and travel, that immediate place is to be kept clean and holy - FOR GOD WALKS IN THAT PLACE.
One's personal responsibilities or stewardship include providing for one's own care - food and lodging - sometimes extending (by God's leading) to the team God has gathered to do ministry with you.
God designed His kingdom with the nature (we could say DNA) to increase in size (number); adding, multiplying, and enlarging.
The priesthood (sons of Aaron) were like the body of Christ today, our inheritance is not on earth, but of a spiritual or eternal kingdom nature.
Christ-followers are to be socially and morally responsible in their communities - respecting neighbors, nature, and God's standards.
Our prayers should be based on the true nature, character, and expressed will of God.
Love - especially the sexual passions - is of a fiery, powerful nature, almost impossible to extinguish.
Every one of God's decisions and actions is right (upright) according to God's 'holy, holy, holy' nature.
God, as Creator, is not bound by the laws of nature, but remains LORD over all to accomplish His good will and pleasure.
God's wonderful works in nature are alone worth considering - just think about all He does.
The sin nature of man brings forth sinful behavior from within a man - the heart of man is sinful, bent away from God.
Man is born in sin - with a sin nature, old man - in the line of Adam.
Some adjustments in thinking - especially of a religious or theological  nature - can only be adjust when God shows one the way He wants him to see it.
Human nature pushes for greatness while Christ-likeness pushes toward serving others.
God is just and right in judgment and in releasing His mercy according to His own nature and purpose.
God utilizes nature in releasing His wrath when He chooses to do so.

Since God has made us partakes of His nature in Christ, we should deliberately, earnestly increase our faith in Him in these things: virtue, knowledge, self-control, perseverance, godliness, brotherly kindness, and love - always in increasing amounts.

Through learning of God each Christ-follower has opportunity to (1) learn the exceedingly great and precious promises given him and (2) partake in God's nature in him through applying the promises in his life.
The LORD God of creation has all nature (including time) under His full control.
Nature (including time) is fully under the hand of the Creator God who put nature (and time) into place.
God will judge all those - even among His saints - who are not genuinely Christ-followers, but are indeed ungodly in nature.
Sometimes God grants His obedient servants influence over nature for a period of time in order to achieve God's revealed will.
God has built into the nature of His kingdom that it spread - that it grows larger and larger to include more and more people.
Jesus taught by example how to live (through peace or storms) by trusting in God - even at times exercising authority over nature; according to the will of God.
God impregnated young Mary so He could  introduce the last Adam, a man born without the sin nature passed down from Adam.

There are those among God's servants who do not know the LORD - serving out of some inferior motive (selfish in nature) and bringing shame to the ministry - damaging the relationship of others with their God.
Not all sermons given a man of God from the LORD are 'positive' in nature.
Even prayer to the FATHER is not to be taken for granted, but approached on the basis of God's nature; mercy, faithfulness, promises, and His character.
So many questions about creation and the working of what we call nature reveals God alone is God and man is limited under God.
Jesus will even alter the impact of nature to minister to His own.
Jesus commands all nature - interrupting it when He chooses.

God alters the course of nature as His sons and disciples trust in Him to do so: quiet a storm, heal the sick, not give rain, give rain, open a river or sea, collapse a wall, perpetual oil, men walk out of fiery furnace, lions refuse to eat, poisonous snakes not effect, food multiplies.
Teaching from a God-related point of view will be authoritative in nature.
God's Word has been given Christ-followers so they can apply it in life - experiencing and expressing God's nature in them.
It is the nature of God's kingdom to grow - increase.
God's kind of love is very powerful - in that it makes a radical impact on others and that it is so different from love produced by the sin nature.
Disciples of Christ are to live and minister without external restraints of religious nature.
God is sovereign - even over all of nature.
The LORD God is sovereign over nature , man, and the affairs of mankind.
Cataclysmic events in nature will precede the return of Jesus Christ.
