Keep a 'long' view when interacting with animals in nature.
The old sin nature or flesh cannot be made new by adding 'patches.'
The LORD is sovereign over nature.
God so works in the life of some they come to a spiritual leader asking the right, eternal-nature questions.
God is merciful in nature.
God is over creation and nature.
Nature is God's creation.
God controls nature.
Spiritual leaders sometimes react in the old flesh nature to God's working through them.
God has power over nature.
Through the very great and precious promises God has given each Christ-follower, they may participate or share in the divine nature.
When the Christ-follower is so participating in the divine nature, he is escaping the corruption in the world caused by evil desires and lusts.

A Christ-follower won't fall who is participating in the divine nature; escaping corruption in the world, adding virtues to their faith, has a proper look forward and backward BUT will receive a rich welcome into heaven.
God will not spare from hell those who follow the corrupt desires of the sinful nature and who despise authority.
False teachers appeal to the lustful desires of the sinful nature.
Christ-followers are to invest their lives in treasures of heavenly or spiritual nature because where one's treasure is there will their heart be also.
It is not possible for the old nature - old man or flesh - to receive new life in Christ.
God's purpose for those who receive His promise is of an unchanging nature.
Sometimes Christ-followers need to be urged to do very specific things - even things considered very basic in spiritual nature.
God's covenant or promise regarding salvation and redemption is eternal in nature.
There are matters, issues, truths, or principles of a spiritual nature.
When one commits his life to Christ in salvation, his old nature is crucified.
That is, the old nature is reckoned as dead.
Life that comes from God is of an eternal nature - that is, it is an eternal kind of life.
As a priest of royal nature to the most high God, Christ-followers offer their own body, offer praise, offer their substance, and offer service.
God has made two true this about Himself plain to all men since creation - (1) His eternal power and (2) His divine nature.
God's eternal power and divine nature have been clearly seen so that men are without an excuse before God.
The old self (old sin nature) has been crucified (died).
The old or sinful nature controls the unregenerate person.
The sinful passions of that old nature were aroused by the law.
Since believers have died to that old sinful nature, they have been released from the law to serve in the new way by the Holy Spirit.
The old nature reacts to law laws by producing desires to violate the laws.
This sinful nature of man is not good - nothing good resides in this sinful nature.
The old nature wages war against the spiritual inner man and wants to move towards soon.
God through Jesus Christ rescues the believer from the "death" brought about by the sinful nature.
The believer is a slave to God's law in the inner man and the sinful nature is a slave to the law of sin.
The law could not overcome the sinful nature in man, but God did through the sacrifice of Jesus Christ.
Believers live according to the Spirit not according to the old sin nature.
Those who live according to the old sin nature have their minds set on what that nature desires.
The mind so set on the old sin nature is hostile toward God.
A mind set on the old sin nature does not (yeah, can not) submit to God's law.
Those controlled by the old sin nature cannot please God.
Those who live according to the sinful nature will die.
Believers are not to think about how to gratify the desires of the sinful nature.
Sometimes God's supply for His people is nothing short of miraculous in nature and method.
Appealing for mercy and forgiveness are based on God's nature of love.
Things of nature know the true God and His nature.
Leaders and all should remember our sinful nature and sinful tendency.
Believers are to subdue or deaden in this life whatever belongs to the earthly nature - sexual immorality, impurity, lust, evil desires, and greed.
All of nature says, 'The Lord reigns.'
Treating these this way expresses our Father's nature which is at work in us - Christ-followers.
Jesus exercise the authority over elements of nature.
God created nature with His wisdom, power, and creativity.
If a person is unfaithful and irresponsible with material or earthly things, the LORD will not grant this one more things of an eternal nature.

Christ-followers are responsible to God for how they use their mind and heart - putting in it and meditating on good, true, pure, wholesome and godly truths; SO THAT the words they speak are of a spiritual, godly, wholesome, good nature.

It is essential as a believing disciple of Jesus Christ to (1) know for certain Jesus is the Son of God, (2) sent by God into the world as Savior (3) believing and receiving the words and teachings of Jesus as God's Word, Truth, (4) believing God 'sourced' the life and ministry of Jesus - direction, power, healings, riasing the dead, ruling over nature, victory over sin, wisdom in all Scripture, and (5) keeping a hold on God's Word (a recepticle to believe and apply God's Word).
The teaching of laws and Scriptures about the 'outside limits' of behavior is aimed at the unsaved - outside of Christ - whose ungodly nature is the primary influence of their life.
God\'s nature includes being just and holy as well as being merciful and loving.

Christ-followers face enemies as we follow God\'s leadership - enemies of human nature and enemies of spirit nature (invisible, fallen angels) - and are to fight our enemies by God\'s means: (1) human enemies, we attack with love, blessing, good deeds, and intercessory prayer and (2) spiritual enemies, we attack with (a) knowledge of who we are iN CHRIST, (b) our obedience by faith, (c) knowledge and application of the Word of God, and (d) prayers of all kinds.
Some expressions of genuine heart-faith received by the LORD are quite humble in nature and quite public in expression.
Public reports of a negative nature by influential and unbelieving (toward God) leaders can prompt a majority of God\'s people to respond negatively (toward God\'s Word) in an unbelieving way.
The spiritual leaders assigned by God are to be respected by the body of Christ - respect of a godly nature.
God can and does engage nature to work with Him in accomplishing His purposes.
The LORD our God is VERY GREAT - creation, nature, and man are under (dependent upon) the LORD our God.
Those who walk with the LORD in a loving, trust relationship are solid like a mountain which cannot be moved.

As Jesus deliberately took these three on the mountain to see His glory, disciple makers today should deliberately take disciples with them when they are in the midst of doing God's will in God's way.
Even a rather restricted or limited setting, God can grant a faithful servant avenues to proclaim and explain (1) His Word on Jesus Christ and (2) the Kingdom of God to all who will hear.

Those in Christ with the responsibility of proclaiming God's Word (1) should do so when it is convenient and inconvenient, (2) should do so convincingly, (3) should do so to rebuke those making wrong choices, (4) should do so for the purpose of encouraging, and (5) should do so with patience using the avenue of teaching God's Word.
Special or intimate spiritual moments are not to be held onto like mementos, but held in spirit as spiritual markers along the way (avenue) God is walking us.
The Gospel is needed in small venues and large alike.
The message may be rejected in one venue received in another.
Believers should give to everyone what is owed - whether taxes, revenue, respect, or honor.

Christ-followers should withdraw fellowship from spiritual leaders (teachers) who (1) teach anything other than fulfilling all stewardship of responsibilities with godly attitude and actions and (2) teach godliness is a means (way, avenue) to financial gain.
Many different topics or ideas can be taught using parables.

A multitude of Christ-followers being filled with the Holy Spirit may manifest in the following: (1) being one in heart and soul, (2) overcome with generosity with their possessions, and (3) some gifted ones proclaim the Gospel of Jesus Christ.
Personal revival toward God can bring generosity to those who experience it.
Generosity is a virtue that results indirectly in blessings to the giver.
Generosity to the needy prompts thanksgiving to God through or for those who announced the need and stirred up the mercy offering.
The testimony of one assembly of Christ-followers can inspire others to obey God in generosity toward those in real need.
A generous man comes up with the generous plans - by generosity His name is established.
A generous man devises generous things and by generosity will stand.
Generosity is a virtue which pays dividends.
The spiritual gift of prophecy is to speak under the inspiration of God's Spirit - to be led by God's Spirit.
A Christ-follower whose heart is 'AFTER GOD'S HEART' might well pray (1) for God's guidance through the Word and (2) for God's grace to avoid dominion by any sin.
Christ-followers should daily seek the LORD's face with trust for (1) teaching, (2) guidance, and (3) revival.
Those who are wise enough to realize they need God's unique direction / guidance; humble themselves (fast and pray), and receive God's Word as well as receive God's direction.
The LORD has brought to reality the 'guidance' of His Holy Spirit to each Christ-follower.

Not all miracles of healing, casting out of demons, or any miraculous actions done is Jesus' name are simply a repeating of words or gestures like at other times, but require current, unique dependence on God while following the Spirit's guidance.
The ungodly will try all kinds of schemes to distract, dissuade, and discourage the faithful obedience of God's people.  Thus, the godly must continue to lean upon God for wisdom and guidance.
Spiritual leaders should seek God's guidance as they carry on to obey Him - trusting Him to get them to His planned destination (including whatever protection necessary).
What we in Christ do we should do (1) in response to God's guidance, (2) in God's power, (3) with trust in God, and (4) for God's glory.
Jesus chose with God's guidance a man needing and wanting healing for 38 years - see the compassion of Jesus and the intimacy of Jesus with the Father.
God's people need to listen to the LORD and pay attention to what He says - for He teaches His people - giving them wonderful counsel and excellent guidance.
Those in a relationship with God normally seek God's guidance in matters - God's direction and Word on what to do.

Those who cover their sins rather than confess them fail to prosper due to the fact that their unconfessed sins have brought about a 'clogged communication line' between them and God.  Thus, they don't hear God's guidance, God's rebuke or corrections, or God's wisdom.

Itinerate spiritual leaders (teachers, preachers, apostles, etc.) (1) seek God's guidance to be with their disciples again, (2) seek God in prayer that loving one another become characteristic of their disciples, (3) seek God in prayer that their disciples will live holy lives (set apart, obedient by faith), and (4) finish well this life in Christ at His coming with all other saints.
The Holy Spirit is Teacher to those who in relationship with God are looking to God for guidance.
Those of God's people who need and want guidance ask God in prayer with faith for guidance.
God gives to His people guidance and assurance through visions.
God grants to those who walk with Him guidance, faith, protection, provision, Spirit-inspired living, and His presence.
God will give guidance to His obedient children - where to be or not to be as well as when to be there.
A man after God's own heart seeks counsel for guidance from the LORD - even details of where to go if God wills.
Those in Christ who are trusting in the LORD should seek daily His counsel and guidance.
God gives guidance in harmony with His Word.
God gives good counsel and guidance.
Those who have a heart for God seek His leadership and guidance.
Those with a heart for God ask God to reveal Himself and give guidance.
A dynamic relationship with God demands that followers live and walk according to God's Word and God's Guidance.
Christ-followers are to seek guidance from God not counterfeit means.
The God who is Sovereign gives His obedient children strength, agility, guidance, and power (ability).
The LORD will confirm His guidance when such is sought.
Leaders ought to ask God for His guidance.
Christ-followers are to pray for divine guidance and protection.
Young spiritual leaders need guidance and mentoring from more experienced spiritual leaders.
God's guidance and leadership is 'No' sometimes.
God gives guidance to His people which will protect them from communicable diseases.
Life's practical situations can be taken to spiritual leaders and to God for guidance and answers.
Unfaithfulness to God can be defined or described by (1) not keeping God's Word [lack of obedience] and (2) not seeking God's guidance - even seeking guidance from the spiritual enemy.
The revelations, declarations, leadership, and guidance of the Holy Spirit are essential (not optional) to each Christ-follower to knowing and doing God's will.
The guidance of the Holy Spirit is an indispensable Asset in receiving and knowing God\'s Truth, Word.

Christ-followers should set aside time regularly to REMEMBER from where God delivered them, their spiritual heritage, and their covenant relationship with God: (1) God executed His mercy, grace, power, and guidance to save them from slavery, (2) the shed blood of the Lamb APPLIED brought (and bought) their salvation, and (3) ALL the (completed) WORK necessary to secure the covenant relationship is DONE.
God humbles His people so they will learn to (1) follow His guidance, (2) live according to His Word and His ways, and (3) experience His sustaining grace.

As a community of Christ-followers, there is sharing of and a rejoicing in the harvest of all who participated in the work as well as those who benefited from the harvest (what was \"brought in\") - all of which brings them to remember God\'s salvation, guidance, and provision.
Spiritual leaders should recognize one another as being unique in God\'s calling, gifting, guidance, and relationship, and, apart from sin, let each other be.

When times of persecution and suffering come to faithful followers fo Christ, they need to remember what Jesus said (chapters 14, 15, 16) in order to avoid stumbling or falling away: (1) obey Jesus' teachings, (2) experience intimacy with the Father, (3) your much fruit will remain, and (4) the Holy Spirit (Helper, Comforter) is with you.
The sayings, actions, and teachings of Jesus Christ were told Him - spoken to Him - by the Father, God.
The teachings of Jesus are radically different from those of 'earth-bound' man.
He who ignores the teachings of Jesus will crumble when hit with the storms of life.
Jesus (the LORD) is present with all those who are making disciples - teaching them to put into practice the teachings of Jesus to all the ethnic groups of the world.
Those who fail to practice the teachings of Jesus are unwise and will crumble against rising waters.
Those who receive and practice the teachings of Jesus are wise and will stand against rising waters.
It is foolish to ignore the teachings of Jesus Christ.
The teachings of Jesus in Mathew 5-7 provide a firm foundation for life when applied daily to the same.

It is essential as a believing disciple of Jesus Christ to (1) know for certain Jesus is the Son of God, (2) sent by God into the world as Savior (3) believing and receiving the words and teachings of Jesus as God's Word, Truth, (4) believing God 'sourced' the life and ministry of Jesus - direction, power, healings, riasing the dead, ruling over nature, victory over sin, wisdom in all Scripture, and (5) keeping a hold on God's Word (a recepticle to believe and apply God's Word).
To be a Christ-follower is to do by faith what the LORD says - practice the teachings of Jesus Christ.
Kindness and provision may come to God's faithful (and those accompanying them) in the most unexpected ways and by people least expected to help.
God can place some kind people (show kindness to God's faithful) in just the right places to touch His faithful servants with kindness.
Those who are "after God's heart' see Him as (1) trainer, (2) lovingkindness, (3) fortress, (4) high tower, (5) deliverer, (6) shield, and (7) refuge.
Those in Christ who seek God's heart and are yielded to God's will are conscious of God's enduring mercy (lovingkindness) toward them.
Do you know God is a merciful and gracious God, abundant in lovingkindness?
Those who know God well look to Him to grant them personal revival based on His lovingkindness.
The Holy Spirit in a Christ-follower produces love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, and self-control.
Who says the Old Testament fails to speak of God's mercy and grace, kindness and patience?
There is one legitimate source of a man glorying on earth - that he has an intimate relationship with the Father, knows God as LORD, full of lovingkindness, judgment, and righteousness.

Christ-followers should bless God for all these graces He gives us: (1) forgives our sins, (2) heals our diseases, (3) delivers us from destruction, (4) showers us with His lovingkindness and tender mercy, (5) satisfies us with good things, and (6) renews our strength.
God's rebellious people may see God's wrath for a time, but will see His mercy with everlasting kindness on the other side.
God is full of lovingkindness, goodness,  and mercy toward His people.

Since God has made us partakes of His nature in Christ, we should deliberately, earnestly increase our faith in Him in these things: virtue, knowledge, self-control, perseverance, godliness, brotherly kindness, and love - always in increasing amounts.
Giving thanks to God for His lovingkindness and faithfulness should flow daily from those who know the LORD well.
God is gracious and merciful, slow to anger and abundant in loving kindness.

Those in Christ are selected by God, set apart for God, and loved so much by God - thus, they are to put on or incorporate increasingly in their new life tender mercies, kindness, humility, meekness, long-suffering, forbearance, forgiveness, be loving, peaceful, and thankful.
Some acts of kindness attempted by God's people is returned with rudeness beyond description.
To know by experience God's lovingkindness makes one's life worth living.
Grateful hearts find ways to express such to God - for all the grace and power and kindness He has shown.
Every child of God is preserved by God's mercy, lovingkindness, and truth.
God's merciful kindness is great toward all men - who should praise Him accordingly.
Those who walk with God can declare each morning His lovingkindness and each night declare His faithfulness.

Those who work together with God as servants of God do so regardless of difficulties and do so by the Holy Spirit, by purity, by knowledge, by patients, by kindness, by love, by truth, by the power of God, and by the armor of righteousness.
God may bring calamity and suffering to His people (as even to His Son on the cross) for a time, but His mercy and lovingkindness extends forever to those who are His.

As such (chosen by God, separated by God, and loved by God), disciples are to put on (express outwardly) tender mercies, kindness, humility, meekness, longsuffering, bearing with one another, and forgiving one another.
Jesus appeared to show God's kindness and love - not to judge or condemn.
That which the Spirit of God produces in a disciple of Jesus is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, and self-control.
Disciples of Christ are to adorn themselves with tender mercies, kindness, humility, meekness, longsuffering, forbearance, forgiving, and love.
God's people should treat refugees and aliens with justice and kindness.
In a time of worship, think on God's lovingkindness.
God is to be praised by His people for His loving kindness and faithfulness.
Showing kindness to a 'would be' enemy is characteristic of those with a heart for God.
God shows unfailing kindness to His anointed.

Christ-followers should make every effort to add or increase these things to their life of faith:  to faith goodness, to goodness knowledge, to knowledge self-control, to self-control perseverance, to perseverance godliness, to godliness brotherly kindness, and to brotherly kindness love.
Those given over to a depraved mind live on showing contempt for God's abundant kindness, tolerance, and patience.
Those given over to a depraved mind don't realize that God's kindness is coming toward them to lead them toward repentance.
God's kindness and grace to a people group should not be taken for granted.
God can and does whatever He chooses (nothing is too hard) even to showing loving kindness to thousands and repaying iniquity of fathers into the lives of their children.
God can show His grace and kindness by working through non-believing, idol worshipers in extending care to His chosen.

Those IN CHRIST were saved (as a matter of fact) (1) through the kindness and love of God in Jesus Christ, (2) according to God's mercy, (3) not on the basis of works (deeds) of righteousness they practiced, (4) through the bathing or washing that came with regeneration (recreation, new birth), (5) through the renewing (to make fresh, new or complete change for the better) accomplished by the Holy Spirit, (6) have been justified (legally declared righteous), and (7) become heirs (sonship) based on the hope of eternal life.
Those without a relationship with God often do acts of kindness and mercy in an attempt to appease their guilty conscience.
False teachers in the end times are characterized by (1) bring in destructive heresies, (2) forsake God's truth, (3) they attract by appealing to the flesh, and (4) promise liberty, but enslave.
A vast increase in knowledge is one of the clear signs of the end times.
God wants his people to know something about the end times - mainly that God alone is sovereign over the times and that God alone will bring a victory to His people.
There is a future aspect to salvation which God is ready to reveal in the last days - end times.
The judgment brought by Jesus in the end times will be greater toward those who heard and rejected than those who heard and received God's Word.
Disciples will come under persecution in the end times.
Watch, watch, watch and pray for the end times are coming and Jesus Christ will come again.
Jesus' church (assembly, body) is built on the rock; which is JESUS IS GOD'S CHRIST /MESSIAH, the Son of the Living God.
Were not common shepherds the first zealous evangelists concerning Jesus' coming as Messiah?
The demons - fallen angels and servants of Satan - know Jesus of Nazareth is God's Messiah, Savior.
This Messiah has come once as Savior and will come again as King of kings.
In some passages of the Old Testament are hidden references to the Messiah, the Son of God, Jesus Christ - this is one such passage.
Knowing this, they STILL did not receive Jesus of Bethlehem as Messiah.  Men can know Scripture, but still not receive for themselves what God is saying in the Scriptures.
God's Word concerning the Messiah and Savior's first advent, life, death, and resurrection were fulfilled in Jesus.
People will come in Jesus' name - pretending to be the messiah.
The Old Testament is true in its prophecies and statements of the Messiah being born in the line of King David.
Jesus of Nazareth was (is) the Son of the Living God - the Christ, Messiah, the Anointed One.
In this case of those who heard and rejected Christ, to repent is to turn to God and accept His Messiah - Jesus.
God has made Jesus of Nazareth both Lord and Christ (Messiah).
Jesus of Nazareth, God's Messiah and Emanuel, struggled against sin and rebellion against God.

Those who reject and hate Jesus a Messiah and God's Word, because they have no relationship with God as Father (not born from above into God's forever family), wil likely also reject and hate disciples of Jesus who faithfully present Jesus and God's Word.
A civil court is not the place to argue matters of religion - especially concerning the Bible, beliefs, and following of Christ.
Obedience to or following of other religions (any other than the LORD and His Word, the Bible) is strictly forbidden to all in Christ.
Don't study other religions (unless you are surely grounded in God's truth) lest you fall into worshipping their false gods.
Unregenerate religious people see RELIGION as knowing /doing external rituals to appease a god.
The false gods of the world's religion are nothing else than demons at work.
There will come a time when all peoples of all religions (Christ-followers excluded) will unite in worship of a false image or false god.
Man without Christ needs a new heart (new inner man) IN CHRIST, not a new religion and its rules.
Some involved in Christian-kinds of religion may put as much or more stock in traditions passed down to them from elders than in  God's Word or what is spoken by God's Spirit.
The reasoning of religionists can sometimes be as confusing as the fact that they are actually pushing back against the ONLY hope there is - Jesus Christ.
Religious people, but unsaved, can become very envious and hostile when the message of Christ is being received well - especially among people who formerly participated with them in religion.
Those in Christ involved in declaring God's truth may become the focus of attack by religionists who want to justify their actions and attitudes.
Religionists can come up with the most insane and nit-picky minutia on which to build religious laws or regulations.
Sometimes plain men - as opposed to those who know something of religion - recognize more quickly signs of God at work than religiously trained men.
People follow (practice the religion of) the god they believe is the most powerful or mighty.
Pure and undefiled religion from God's viewpoint involves Christ-followers being merciful toward the needy - like orphans and widows - and obedient by faith to God.

Spiritual leaders must affirm to Christ-followers that the account of Christ's life is valid, factual, and was observed by eye-witnesses - it is not a cunningly devised fable as are all false religions and idol worshipping.
Religionists - without a relationship with Christ - search out and take advantage of opportunities to find others (especially Christ-followers) violating their 'religious rules.'
Those who follow Christ are like brothers, helping one another - not religionists with positions.
God does not grant to His people tolerance to dabble in or practice other religions - only trust, obey, and love Him.
God wants a relationship with worshipers not homage from religionists.
Once one 'steps out on God' he does what the world does (1) hires help with money, (2) copies what the world has and does, and (3) builds his own religion.
Among the multitudes involved in religious activity and those observing religion are some who actually experience God through believing Him.
Religious leaders otherwise established in their religions may experience a 'crack of openness' when a great, personal need surfaces and Jesus is seen as near.
Religionists use meeting places for financial gain.
One can be involved in religion with the one true God while being ignorant of the Bible (its real meaning) and God's real power.
Life can be about religious riddles when one serves a religion based on external rituals and human interpretations.
Religionists are offended when Christ-followers want to purify meetings in His name.
The fleshly way of doing religion cannot be 'patched up' or corrected.
At times, Jesus radically and aggressively rebuked those who turned a relationship with God into a 'religion for profit' business.
Live and minister in relationship with heaven - not religion or materials things.
Those steeped in religious tradition and external religion may not recognize ministry springing out of a love relationship with God.
Such external restraints are nothing less than forms of 'works, religion, external laws, legalism, and NOT of grace.
Jesus does not ask people to follow a religion, but follow Him, a person.
Those who minister within 'religion' have no spiritual integrity - spiritual backbone.
Leaders of false religions and unregenerates may exhibit an unholy boldness to extinguish the truth of God and those who carry God's truth.
Christ-followers are not to follow a teacher of other religions no matter how convincing the argument.
God's people must guard against taking on (practicing) religious practices of ANY other religion.
Some people's religion is made up of external conformity to man-made guidelines.
Leaders of false religions will likely want to do away with the truth of God.
Christ-followers are not to intermarry with people of false beliefs or religions.
Christ-followers ought to abhor the gods and religious paraphernalia of false religions.
Even practitioners of false religions understand they must offer guilt offerings to the God or gods they offended.
Failing to keep a tight rein on one's tongue reveals that such a one is deceived and his religion is worthless.
The religion God accepts as pure involves caring for the truly needy.
People who abandon God may make up their own religion and religious practices.
If a person's 'talk' is not effected by his religion, his religion is worthless.
Some peoples' entire lives are wrapped up in the expression of their false religion.

Some teachers of false doctrine can be described as:  pollute their own bodies; reject authority; slander celestial beings; speak abusively against what they don't understand; use reasoning by instinct; self-developed religion; anxious to curse God's people; or assert self as God's representative.

Christ-followers should be involved in these two demonstrations of their religion -  1) care of widows and orphans in their distress and 2) keep oneself from being polluted by the world; one with others, the other with self.
A demonstration of one's religion can involve outer and inner work.
Inter-religion marriages are against God's Word and usually result in bringing God's people to ruin.
People of false religions are sometimes jealous because of the spreading of the gospel.
False religions prompted by Satan will even go to battle against the Lamb of God.
God receives religious people who turn from their religion to trust solely in Him.
Those who are set on forsaking God to worship others - practice a dead religion - can come to a place where they do not hear God at all.
God allows no diversity of religions among His people.
Some people fear the\' operators\' of acceptable religion.
One man\'s life (heart) - impacting experience with Jesus can be enough to foster faith enough to rebuke the leaders of acceptable religion (who have NO SUCH experience).
Christ-followers should strongly guard the mind and heart of each other - especially the young and ignorant - - - GUARD THEM FROM FALSE TEACHING AND TEACHING OF RELIGIONS.

Peoples in an idolatrous - false religion - culture may see themselves as \'above\' or \'superior\' to those who worship and obey God - so much so as to not even sit together to share a meal at the same table.
God wants His people to know it is displeasing to Him and not acceptable to Him at all if they were to get involved in \'mixing into their life\' any other god or adding a religion.
Satan can so deceive those in idol worshipping religions - false religions - as to believe they are above or superior to those who worship and obey God.
Kings in pagan and idolatrous cultures first seek spiritual counsel from the representatives of their dark, idolatrous religions - anybody but of the Light.
The externally focused religionists are always around to attack Christ-followers for joining with the LORD to put emphasis upon a \'right heart\' and \'heart-deep\' faith and service.
There are those in the \"Christian religion\" who refuse to have Jesus as their King.
When false religions are allowed into the midst of God\'s people, the adherents will teach sinful practices to God\'s people.
Those not surrendered to Christ exercise their self-will to create their own religions and religious leaders apart from God.

When a Christ-follower feels overwhelmed (by enemies, tiredness, responsibilities, whatever) by life, he should trust in God and seek God to lead them up upon the ROCK (our place IN CHRIST) that is 'higher than I' - safe, above in God's presence.
Those in relationship with God who seek God with sincerity and solitude for a word from God will not be disappointed.
Those who earnestly pray, seek God, prepare, and wait on the LORD will prosper.
Men don't seek God - God sends salvation to them.
When under spiritual attack, humble oneself, seek God's face, and call on those who are spiritually attune to pray with you for God's mercy and grace.
A servant of God must, by God's grace and Spirit, seek God and hear God - doing what He says; then, see God work.

Man - apart from God and His activity - is (1) foolish, (2) ignorant, (3) corrupt, (4) commit abominable sins, (5) has no understanding of God, (6) does not seek God, (7) pursues self-interests, (8) does not do good (right), and (9) does not call on nor trust God.
Even when highly motivated to action, it is best and right to 'inquire of God' (seek God's face) to determine God's will on the matter.
Facing enemy opposition? Seek God's direction, trust God's power, take your responsible actions, and see God's breakthrough / victory.
Those in Christ who seek God's heart and are surrendered to His will can see themselves under the 'wings' of God's protection.
Those who seek God's own heart or face know a day in His presence is better than a thousand other days.
Those who would seek God's heart and do His will would do well to meditate on the reality - God is Creator and Sustainer of earth, its inhabitants, and its future.
Those in Christ who seek God's heart and are yielded to God's will are conscious of God's enduring mercy (lovingkindness) toward them.
It is God's 'good pleasure' to give His kingdom to those who seek it - seek God's rule in life.
Spiritual leaders should seek God's guidance as they carry on to obey Him - trusting Him to get them to His planned destination (including whatever protection necessary).
Those in relationship with God as Father seek God's forgiveness for their sins while granting the same forgiveness to those who have offended them.
Those in right relationship with God have every reason to seek God and His mercy in a time of trial.
Those who seek God by faith out of love and devotion for deliverance from oppression will be heard by God and know God's deliverance.
The first thing to do when confronted with overwhelming odds is humble yourself and seek God's presence.
The first thing a leader of God's people should do when confronted by an obstacle or attack is (1) humble himself before God and the people and (2) seek God's face in prayer.
Those in a relationship with God normally seek God's guidance in matters - God's direction and Word on what to do.
When those who are God's are facing an overwhelming situation, they need to seek God, surrender to God, and trust God to do what He chooses.
What a blessing it is - spiritual blessings only or external blessings as God wills - when people (especially leaders) seek God wholeheartedly and walk upright before God.
A leader of God's people is wise when confronted with problems or obstacles to (1) set his heart and mind to seek God and (2) fast with prayer before the LORD to hear from God.
Those in Christ who seek God's wisdom diligently (earnestly) will find it.

Itinerate spiritual leaders (teachers, preachers, apostles, etc.) (1) seek God's guidance to be with their disciples again, (2) seek God in prayer that loving one another become characteristic of their disciples, (3) seek God in prayer that their disciples will live holy lives (set apart, obedient by faith), and (4) finish well this life in Christ at His coming with all other saints.
A leader of God's people should seek God's direction before taking action.
A leader of God's people should seek God's face on taking action or not - letting God direct his life and ministry.
Those with a heart for God seek God's inspection of their heart - asking God to point out sinful things that they might overcome those things in Christ and live in righteousness.

Christ-followers must seek God's face on the matter - though the planned action just looks like a repeat of a previous victorious action - because God might have a different strategy He wants to employee THIS TIME.
Man, on his own, does not do good in the eyes of the LORD - nor does a man on his own seek God.
Those with a heart for God seek God and God's presence.
It would do Christ-followers well to seek God's deliverance from deceitful and unjust men in this life.
There are none who do good, none who seek God.
God's people need to seek God's counsel when decisions need made - even if a matter 'looks' simple.
A man of God should seek God, let God show him what He will, and say as well as do what God reveals as being from Him.
Those God appoints to His service are to obey God's Word, seek godly counsel, and seek God in prayer.
Those of God's appointed leaders who want to experience continued victories must seek God's direction continually for His unique strategy for going forward.
When God's people are facing an obstacle, the leadership should declare a fast with prayer (out of humility and fear) toward God to seek God and His word and will regarding the obstacle.
One day Jerusalem will be the place where many nations will seek God - Who is 'with Israel.'
Those who depend on God seek God in prayer.
God's people seek God in heaven through faith and prayer.
Godly leaders seek God in prayer.
Leaders would do well to humble themselves and seek God when faced with overwhelming circumstances.
The time to seek God is immediate to those who sense a drawing toward Him.
Spiritual leaders seek God when in distress.
Spiritual leaders seek God in prayer - want God to hear their prayers.
Those who seek God in prayer must trust God.
Those who seek God with a whole heart and pure heart will enjoy His presence.
topics: Whole heart, pure heart, enjoy, God's presence

results.text: Those with a heart for God seek God's mercy - admitting their sins.
Those with a heart for God seek God's leadership.
Those with a heart for God seek God and expect to see God.
topics: Seek God, see God, expect, expectation

results.text: Those who seek God will not lack any good thing.
God's servants desire and seek God's strength to do God's work.
God's people should seek God - not men.
Those with a heart for God seek God with a thirsty soul.
To those who humbly and wholeheartedly seek God, He will be with them.
Public proclamation of a wholehearted personal commitment to seek God is honored by God.
Seek God before you act in His name.
When searching, seek spiritual counsel - seek God and His Word on the search topic.
The people of God need to seek God for wisdom in making decisions.
Seek God's will and timing before acting.
Those who seek God will never be forsaken by God.
A relationship with God will be experienced by those who seek God with their whole heart.
Those who relate to God are to seek God and obey His leading.
Those who seek God in the matters of God will receive what they  Why? Because God and His Spirit are drawing them to Himself.
Those who will seek God work His work are those who express actual faith in God - believing He is God, over all, and that He rewards those who trust in Him.
The people of God ought to want / desire to inquire of God - seek God - in all matters of life.
(7) Seek God's face.
Leaders should seek God before taking action.
Christ-followers want and need to seek God at work.
Spiritual leaders need to seek God's leadership / word on an issue BEFORE proceeding.
Right advice to sufferers as well as others, seek God in all circumstances - draw near to God.

In the midst of suffering the most essential elements of faith in God can come forth: God is real and alive, I will seek God and be with God myself, and this hope puts a yearning in my heart for that day.

Those of God people who through crises keep their eyes on God, fearing and trusting God,  and humble themselves will likely (1) seek God and themselves more clearly, (2) have a richer relationship with God, and (3) be used in service by God.
Sometimes appointed leaders among God\'s people make poor decisions because they fail to seek God and His input regarding the decisions.
Those who seek God\'s presence can be found calling on God daily, morning by morning seeking the LORD.
There are those among God\'s people who intercede to God for their enemies to \"Seek God.\"
Those who set themselves to seek God\'s heart and God\'s will put God first before themselves.
Those IN CHRIST who seek God’s heart have the capacity and can exercise the desire to show mercy to the offspring of those who have despised them.
Let those IN CHRIST who seek God\'s heart send up \"clouds of incense\" to the LORD - prayer upon prayers.
Those who seek God\'s heart and will wholeheartedly desire God\'s peace and faithfulness on His people.
